loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
La Señora Lina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”, ubicado en la provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijo.
La señora Lina estudió educación secundaria (completo).

La señora Lina esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde este ciclo,  nos cuenta que con el  préstamo solicitado de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, podrá incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de artefactos electrodomésticos.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una  tienda propia y tener una casa en el centro de la ciudad.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las  capacitaciones que se dan.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of the communal bank “Las Perlas II”, located in the province of Huancané, Puno department. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 children. Lina finished her secondary education. Lina has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since this cycle. She tells us that with the loan she has asked for in the amount of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she will be able to increase the capital for her business selling appliances. Her dream for the future is to have her own store and have a house in the center of town. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the trainings that it has.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy appliances

loans.name: Horlinda

texts.es: Horlinda tiene 65 años, es una madre de familia muy cariñosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijas ya mayores. Hace más de 30 años vende gaseosas, cervezas, productos comestibles y condimentos en general, de esa manera ha logrado tener bien surtido su bodega, situado en el pequeño espacio de la parte delantera de su casa. Siendo así uno de los negocios más concurridos de su barrio, debido a la atención que tiene con sus clientes y la variedad de productos que vende, que son de mucha demanda y a un precio bien cómodo. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, por tanto espera mas  adelante ampliar su negocio, ya que le permite captar buenas utilidades que las comparte con su adorado esposo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas, ya que le gustaría contar con posteriores prestamos. Con este crédito que solicita, piensa comprar más mercaderías para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Horlinda, 65, is an affectionate, hard working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and five adult daughters. For over 30 years she has sold soft drinks, beer, food items and condiments. She has kept her store, which is located in the front of her house, well stocked. It is one of the neighborhood’s most popular stores thanks to the variety of goods she stocks and the customer service she provides; her goods are in high demand and her prices are fair. She enjoys her work very much so hopes to enlarge the sore in the future because it produces good profits that she shares with her adored husband. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she commits to repaying it on time because she’d like to be able to count on future loans. She will use the requested funds to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more items to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”, ubicado en la provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 05 hijo.
La señora estudió educación secundaria (completo).

La señora María esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses como grupo mientras tanto y en la actualidad como Banco Comunal,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad la señora  solicitará un nuevo crédito S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para incrementar el capital de su negocio y poder comprar más productos, nos cuenta también que tiene una fotocopiadora donde realiza servicio de fotocopias.

Su sueño para el futuro  es incrementar su capital  para hacer crecer el negocio y tener una casa.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Las Perlas II” communal bank, located in the Huancané province, in the Puno department. She is 39 years old, has a junior high school education, is married, and has five children. María has been working with “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for eight months as a group, and now as a communal bank. She tells us that the first loan of 500 PEN allowed her to increase her grocery business’ working capital. Now she is asking for a loan of 800 PEN ($300). This money will help her increase her working capital to invest in more products. She also tells us that she has a photocopier with which she provides copy services. Her dream is to increase her capital so that she can grow her business and build a house. What she likes the most about her communal bank is its punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La Señora Mariluz  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”  ubicado en la provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, actualmente continúa estudiando.

La señora Mariluz esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde este ciclo,  nos cuenta que con el préstamo solicitado de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, podrá incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de artefactos electrodomésticos.

Su sueño para el futuro  es incrementar su capital y mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la organización y el cumplimiento de los pagos.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a member of "Las Perlas II" community bank, located in Huancané province in the department of Puno. She is 23 years old and has 1 child with her partner. Mariluz is currently a student. This is her first loan cycle with Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She is requesting a 500 PEN loan to increase working capital for her business selling household appliances. Mariluz dreams of accessing enough capital to improve her business. What she likes most about her community bank is the organization and timely loan repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household appliances.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy conversadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace muchos años atrás, se dedicaba a la elaboración de desinfectantes y jabones líquidos con aromas de fresa, manzana, sandia, mandarina y melocotón, en un inicio le fue bien, hasta que aparecieron los hipermercados, su negocio cayo y no pudo competir. Desde entonces trabaja preparando platos típicos de la serranía peruana, de esa manera han transcurrido 3 años y hasta ahora sus clientes acuden a su establecimiento para consumir uno de sus tan deliciosas comidas. Los días que más negocio tiene son los fines de semana, por lo que logra vender todo lo que prepara, resultándole muy rentable este negocio. En un futuro dese tener otro negocio que le genere más rentabilidad, como es el de instalar una librería en su casa. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas, ya que como líder de su grupo debe dar el ejemplo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingrediente para su preparar más platillos, así como una vitrinas para su futura librería, con las que va diversificar sus ingresos en su economía.
texts.en:
Betty is 40 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children in their own home. Many years ago, Betty started a business making cleaning products and soaps with the fresh scent of strawberry, apple, watermelon and peach. In the beginning her business did well. But then the supermarkets started to appear and sales fell because she couldn't compete. After that, Betty began a new business preparing typical Peruvian dishes. She's been running her new business for 3 years now, and her customers frequent her small restaurant for the delicious meals she prepares. The busiest days are the weekends, when she sells every meal she prepares, making this a very good business. Going forward, she would like to have another business that will generate more income, so she is considering opening a small general store in her home. This is Betty's 13th loan with MFP and she has complied with all of her payments. As a leader in her group she sets a good example. With the new loan, she will purchase ingredients to prepare her meals, as well as a display case for her new general store. In this way she hopes to diversify her income and economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare the meals she sells, as well as a display case for the small general store she is opening in her home.

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: Ma Guadalupe Tojo M. trabaja en una maquiladora donde se levanta temprano para ir a su labor. Ella es madre de 2 hijos que están en edad escolar, es por ello que solicita un crédito para comprar los útiles escolares, uniformes. Ma Guadalupe quiere ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación para que en un futuro sean personas profesionistas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Martinez works in a beauty store and gets up very early every day to get to her job. She is the mother of 2 children who are currently attending school. Guadalupe is requesting a loan to purchase school supplies and uniforms for her children. She would like to provide her children with a good education, so they will have good professions in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help pay for school supplies and uniforms for her two children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make necessary repairs on her small home

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es: La señora Maricruz G. S. solicita de un préstamo para poder impermeabilizar su vivienda; por que en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina y su techo se esta deteriorando. Maricruz teme que si deja este problemita puede que se agrave y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. La señora trabaja en maquiladora y su esposo desde EUA le envía dinero para que cubra los gastos que se aproximen.
texts.en:
Maricruz G. S. is asking for a loan so that she can make her home waterproof. During the rainy season the water seeps through her roof, which is causing it to deteriorate. Maricruz is worried that if she doesn’t fix it the problem will only get worse, and she will have to pay even more to fix her roof. Maricruz works at an assembly plant and her husband works in the US and sends her money to cover their expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproofing her home

loans.name: Grethel

texts.es: Grethel, es una mujer muy laboriosa, felizmente casada con el padre de sus 6 hijos, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motor de su trabajo. Hace 3 años vendía bisuterías de manera informal en la puerta del mercado más grande de su distrito. Sin embargo quiso consolidarse en este negocio, así que logró obtener un permiso de la municipalidad, desde entonces vende todo tipo de productos como, ganchos, binchas y demás accesorios de cabello, ya que la venta de estas baratijas le dejaban buenas utilidades. Han transcurrido un año, por lo que ahora trabaja con su hija, ambas se turnan, solo así pueda tener tiempo de poder administrar la renta de su carro que posee. Ahora esta al pendiente del alquiler del carro, así como del mantenimiento técnico y la compra de repuestos. En adelante, piensa terminar de construir su casa, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas como lo venía haciendo. Asimismo comenta su alegría de pertenecer a su grupo, por lo que sus compañeras son muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar las llantas de su carro, de ese modo continuará alquilando su carro.
texts.en:
Grethel is an industrious woman who is happily married to the father of her six children. She lives in her own home with her husband and two of her children, who are the reason behind her work. For three years she has been informally selling trinkets at the entrance of the largest market in her district. In order to formally establish this business, she obtained a permit from the municipality. Since then she has sold all types of products such as hair clips, headbands, and other hair accessories. The sale of these trinkets has provided her with good profits. Now that a year has passed, Grethel currently works with her daughter and they take turns managing the business. This gives her time to manage the rental income she generates from the car she owns. Since she makes her car available for rent, she needs to buy spare parts in order to keep it maintained. In the future, she plans to finish the construction of her house so that she can improve the quality of life for her children.

This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. Grethel promises to complete all of her payments as she has done in the past. She says it has been a joy being a part of her group because all of the members are very responsible. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tires for her car so that she can continue making it available for rent.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for her rental vehicle

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: Ma. Angélica V. L.  adquirió una vivienda de interés social y desea poner protecciones para que este mejor protegida y dar mayor seguridad a su familia. Para poder realizar su proyecto ella necesita comprar material y que se le instalen. Su esposo y ella trabajan para cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
María Angélica V. L. got a publicly subsidized house and she wants to put up security so that her house is better protected and provide more security for her family. In order to be able to complete this project, she needs to purchase material and for them to install it for her. She and her husband work to cover the costs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add security to her house

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas M. S. es padre de 2 pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, es por ello que el y su esposa trabaja en maquiladora tiempo extra para poder completar con los gastos de la casa y ofrecer una buena educación.  En este momento el requiere de un préstamo para comprar los artículos escolares y compra de uniformes.
texts.en:
Tomas M. S. is the father of two children, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. For this reason, he and his wife work extra time in an assembly plant so that they can meet the household expenses and provide them with a better education. At this time, he is requesting a loan to purchase school supplies and uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock her business.

loans.name: Delia Concepción

texts.es: Delia Concepción A. González fue construyendo su casa poco a poco, este momento pide el apoyo para poder terminar su baño ya que le falta enjarrar las paredes y pintar para dar mejor aspecto. Ella es madre de tres pequeños los cuales quiere ofrecer un mejor patrimonio, es por ello que trabaja como cajera y su esposo es ayudante en un taller de pintura para automóviles.
texts.en:
Delia Concepcion A. G. started building his house. He requests support to finish the bathroom. The walls remain to be finished and painted. She is the mother of three little ones, to whom she would like to provide living conditions. It is for their sakes that she works as a cashier and her husband is an assistant in an auto body shop.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the bathroom.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica V. B. y su esposo desde hace un año se dedican a la venta de pan de elote y de maíz que ellos mismo preparan, su producto lo ofrecen en cada negocio del centro de la ciudad, este es llamado comida campirana que provienen de la ciudad que vivían. Este préstamo lo desea utilizar para comprar más ingredientes para seguir preparando este suculento pan.
texts.en:
Yessica V. B. has been selling corn bread for the past year, together with her husband. They make the bread themselves and they sell their product to the businesses in the city's downtown. This food product is a country food staple, traditional to the region from where they used to live. This loan will be used to purchase more ingredients to keep making this delicious bread.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús Vásquez Salazar cuenta con negocio de la venta de carne asada, , salchichas, hamburguesas, frijoles rancheros, a un bajo precio, este negocio se ubica en su misma vivienda. El es muy conocido ya que ofrece buenos paquetes familiares a un precio de acuerdo a la economía familiar, pero como van muy bien en la venta el quiere comprar mas producto para así estar abastecido y dar mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jesus V. Salazar has a business selling roasted meats, sausages, hamburgers, and ranchero style beans. He sells his products at a good price. His business is located in a section in his home. He is very well known because he offers good family deals, at a price that is comfortable to the typical family economy. But because the business is so successful he needs to purchase more products to keep the restaurant going and to keep up the excellent attention he provides his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build his own home.

loans.name: Sime John Anatholy

texts.es: El señor M. S. Sime John Anatholy, vive en casa de su madre ubicada en Asociación de vivienda las Arenas B catorce junto a sus hermanos mayores , el solicitante se dedica a la actividad de chofer de mototaxi la cuál es propia y fue adquirida hace un año con el apoyo de su madre, solicita el crédito para realizar trámites de sus estudios superiores en la universidad de su ciudad, Desea culminar sus estudios y trabajar a la vez para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Sime John Anatholy M. S. lives with his older siblings in his mother’s house located in the housing association, Las Arenas B-14. He works as a mototaxi driver – the mototaxi is his and he got it a year ago with the help of his mother. He is requesting the loan to be able to complete the procedures for his post-secondary studies at his city’s university. He wants to finish his studies and work at the same time to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal needs

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario Ernesto M. de 31 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador y un padre de familia responsable con su hogar, el vive junto a su esposa, quien le ayuda con el negocio y así mismo realiza los quehaceres del hogar, también vive junto a sus tres hijos, todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Mario posee un bazar, en el cual comercializa: ropa, zapatos, accesorios para arreglar regalos, cremas, shampoo, tintes para el cabello y otros productos más los cuales son destinados para diferentes usos. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde vende con sus vecinos y amigos, los cuales dan muy buenas referencias de él ya que se destaca por ser una excelente persona. Mario solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir el bazar con más productos de primera necesidad, así de esta forma él espera contar con más ganancias las cuales sean de mucho beneficio para su familia, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee, por lo que desea mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
Mario Ernesto M. is 31 years old. He is a very hardworking man and is a father who is responsible. He lives with his wife, who helps him with the business and does the household chores. He also lives with his three children, all of whom are young and are students.

Mario has a small store where he sells clothing, shoes, gift wrapping accessories, creams, shampoos, hair dyes and other products for various uses. The business is located in his home and he sells to his neighbors and friends, who give very good references of him since he stands out for being a great person.

Mario is requesting a loan so that he can stock his store with more basic needs items. In doing so, he hopes to have more earnings, which are very beneficial for his family since it is his only source of income. This is why he wants to improve his service.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic needs items

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús G. E. de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su única hija de 13 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Manuel es padre soltero, quien trabaja en su propio negocio el cual es un fotoestudio en el que se encarga de tomar fotos para diferentes ocasiones y así también comercializa diferentes productos como portarretratos, rollos para cámara entre otros más. Desde hace 8 años que se dedica a este oficio, y es muy conocido en la zona de Colón por su excelente trabajo, Manuel cuenta con muchos beneficios entre los cuales están: la excelente ubicación, debido a que se encuentra sobre la calle principal de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual reside junto a su hija. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual se le facilite el modernizar su fotoestudio, comprando cámaras digitales, diferentes tamaños de flashes y otros accesorios más los cuales son básicos en este tipo de negocio. Todo esto lo hace con fin de mejorar sus servicios y de esta forma contar con más clientela.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús G. E. is 42 years old and lives with his only daughter who is thirteen years old and studies. Manuel is a single father and works in his own photography studio business where he takes photos for different occasions and also sells different products such as picture frames and rolls of film amongst others. He has worked in this business for eight years and is known in the area of Colón for his excellent work. Manuel's business has many positive aspects including a great location on the main street of Sonsonate, which is where he lives with his daughter. He is requesting a loan so that he can modernise his photography studio and purchase digital cameras, different flash sizes and other basic accessories. He plans to do this to improve his service and gain more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of accessories for a photography studio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty salon products

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma O. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Emma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Beveline

texts.en:
Beveline R. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 37 years old. Beveline is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Beveline owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Beveline has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Beveline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beveline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Beveline is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Beveline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ngem

texts.en: Mr. K., age 57, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community. He is currently earning an average of $3 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is a father of four children. Three of the children are teenagers and one is married and has started a new family home. Most of his children are employed. His wife, Sokha, works sewing for a garment industry. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals and does a daily routine. K. currently lives in his own house that needs repairs. Because of that, K. has requested a loan to mend his old house.

loans.use: To mend his old house.

loans.name: Cairoding

texts.en:
Cairoding R. is from the village of Barinaut, Iligan City. He is 18 years old. Cairoding is single. To make a living, Cairoding owns & operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Cairoding has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cairoding joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cairoding has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Cairoding is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cairoding from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve his business

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda C. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 59 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community and also running a small bakery. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Minda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Verbina

texts.en:
Verbina Y. is from the village of Kalangahan, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Verbina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Verbina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang S. is a 26-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Sal Soeun, age 28. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to a young child who attends school. 

Due to the coming farming season, Heang S. wants to have farm supplies to use on her farmland. As she lacks money to achieve her requirements, Heang S. has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer and crop seed for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and crop seed for planting.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace C. is from the village of Lacambinue, Baraas, Iligan City. She is 22 years old. Mary Grace is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

location.town: Lacambinue, Baraas, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Srom

texts.en:
Mrs. Srom S. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photograph. Srom S. works sewing clothes in a garment factory to earn a living. Another source of family income is from her husband who works as a construction foreman. He has a few employees who help provide his service. 

Mrs. Srom S. has two young school-aged kids. She still lives in her parents’ house and she hopes to build her own house to live in, but her personal savings is not enough to start building one. To achieve her goal, she decided to take out a loan to be able to afford building a new house.

loans.use: To be able to afford building a new house.

loans.name: Veng

texts.en:
Veng K. is a 50-year-old woman who lives with another family member in Kompong Tom Province. She is a hard working woman and a low income person. 

She owns an old motorcycle that she uses to sell pork, beef, fish, and vegetables door-to-door in and around her community. She is able to make at least $5 per day and has been engaged in this work since 1995. 

She has a life partner in her husband who plants crops to earn a living, and this couple has given birth to five children. Veng K. also buys fish paste in bulk to resell for extra income. 

She is taking out her loan as capital to buy fish paste to resell, which will allow her to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy fish paste to resell.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Mrs. Ham Y. has been spending almost her entire life raising crops and a few animals to make a profit. She is married and has four children, one of whom is already married and lives away from home and the other three are single. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. 

Ham Y. has a single son who needs a partner in his wife, but he requires money to make a wedding party. Because he doesn’t have money yet, Mrs. Ham Y. has decided to pursue a loan to be used to spend on a wedding party for her son.

loans.use: To spend on wedding party for her son.

loans.name: Justino

texts.en:
Justino D. Jr. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old. Justino is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, he runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Justino has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Justino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Ra Sok, have been married since 1978 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. One of them is married and lives in a separate home, two have full-time employment, one daughter assists her mother in the business and the youngest attends school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Srey has been selling vegetables in Phnom Penh market for more than ten years. She has asked for a Kiva loan one time already. She is now asking for another loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita C. is from the village of Abu, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Lucita is separated from her spouse and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lucita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sreyrot

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyrot K. has been a silk weaver for almost ten years. Her husband, Mr. Laihoun Hout, is a motor taxi driver and a boat builder. They were married in 2000 and have one young son. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreyrot is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving and to pay school fees for her brothers.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for continuing her weaving business and pay school fees for her brothers.

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Mr. Song V. (pictured here), is 32 years old. His wife, Mrs. Sokhim Chang, is 28 yeas old. They live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. They have been married for ten years and have three daughters. Two of them are in school and another one is still young. 

Song has been a construction worker for five years, and his wife has been a garment factory worker for seven years. The house where they live is small and it’s difficult for family members to stay, so Song is asking for his first loan of $900 to renovate his house.

loans.use: To renovate the house where he lives.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mr. Channa H., 23, and his wife, Mrs. Sros Dam, 23, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have two children: one son and one daughter. His wife is a garment factory worker.
 
Channa has been producing jars for nine years. He produces jars at his home and transports them to sell in the nearby village and other provinces. He is applying for his first loan of $600 to buy a motorcycle to pull a trailer carrying jars for sale.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to pull a trailer carrying jars for sale

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Mrs. Toch P., 50, is a widow with two sons and three daughters. One of them is married, another is a garment factory worker, and the other three attend school. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Toch has been selling vegetables in Takhmao market for ten years. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Marrisa

texts.en: Marrisa E. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old and is married with two infant children. Marrisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Marrisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Marrisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Mrs. Hin O., 56, is married to Suy Kem, 60, and they have four children. Two of the children are married and live independently while the other two are single and live at home.

Hin O. owns a milling machine that she uses to provide a service to her neighbors. Usually, she mills rice for the dual purpose of charging fees and getting bran. In addition, she raises a few pigs and crops in her village.

Hin O. has a daughter who is single and who wants to become a grocery trader but doesn’t have enough money to make that possible. This is why Hin O. has requested a loan for her daughter to use to build a grocery store where she will sell items.

loans.use: To enable her daughter to build a grocery store

loans.name: Renante

texts.en: Renante Q. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. He is 24 years old and is married with one infant child. Renante owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily making and selling roasted pig (litson) in kilograms in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Renante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Renante plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en: Jero P. S. is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of this eleven-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dewi Fortuna (PK-10295). Jero P. S. is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Jero P. S. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her first from MUK. Jero P. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Jero P. S. 0 (0) merupakan 32 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Jero P. S. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 11 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Dewi Fortuna (PK-10295). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Jero P. S. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Jero P. S. menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Jero P. S. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Jero P. S. meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Eun

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a garment laborer, while her husband (pictured) works in the construction field. This young couple were married two years ago, but they don’t yet have children. Mrs. S. owns a plot of farmland inherited from her parents on which she now hopes to cultivate crops to get additional income. As she lacks capital, Mrs. S. decided to look for assistance in order to plant rice during the approaching farming season.

loans.use: To plant rice.

loans.name: Charlean

texts.en:
Charlean C. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old. Charlean is single. To make a living, Charlean owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Charlean has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Charlean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlean is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Charlean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Mrs. Thong O. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband works on the field with her. Thong O. requests a loan to buy marble from from a nearby mountain quarry. She will turn the marble into statues to sell, which will allow her to improve her daily income.

loans.use: To buy marble to sell

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz B. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Paz is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Paz owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food like viands in the local community. Paz has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Paz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok Y. is a 67-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. Sok Y. is married to Mr. Ou Ken, age 71, who works with her in the farming business. Sok Y. owns a plot of farmland that she uses to plant crops. Growing crops is business with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Sok Y. is concerned that she currently lives in an old house which needs repair. As she doesn’t have money to repair and replace the broken parts of her house, Sok Y. decided to pursue a loan from Kiva’s project partner, HKL.

loans.use: To repair and replace a section of her house.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a resident of a small city in Pakistan called Pakpattan, known for its old history. She owns a small house of two rooms there and has been living in it with her family for over ten years. She is 45 years old and is married with no children.

Shamim is a very hardworking lady. She spends her time in doing household chores and operating her bread-making business. Her nature of work is totally different.

She makes bread in an oven made of mud. She has the oven in her house and serves a large clientele base every day. She sells each loaf for 5 PKRs. She does this work for two reasons: first to earn money so that her family finances run smoothly and secondly she loves this work and in this way her time goes fast in the house.

Her husband’s name is M. A. who is a private entrepreneur and deals in wheat. He buys wheat wholesale and sells it to different shops and to his customers as well. He has been doing this work for past ten years.

Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan he will buy more wheat to increase his sales. She is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable investment for her husband.

In the photo, the person with raised hand is Shamim and the one who is making bread is her group member named Zainab who also has the same business as Shamim.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more wheat to sell

loans.name: Asel's Group

texts.en: Asel S. is the leader of this group. She is twenty-six and married with two children: her sons are four and two years old and both of them are at home. Asel works in a sewing workshop while her husband works for a private entrepreneur in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). In addition to working in the sewing workshop, Asel breeds cattle which she has been doing for almost five years. With the profits from cattle breeding, she has been able to make capital repairs to her house and purchase furniture. Asel is applying for a loan in order to purchase more cattle for breeding and to buy plastic windows for her house. In the future, she is planning to raise her children, give them a high education, and purchase a car. The other group members are: Zhuzumkul Z. is treasurer of the group. She is thirty-six and married with four children: her sons are thirteen and one year old and her daughters are eight and three years old. To earn a living, her husband sings at family celebrations. With the help of her husband, Zhuzumkul breeds cattle which they have been doing for seven years. With the profits from cattle breeding, they have been able to make capital repairs to their house and purchase a car. They are applying for a loan in order to purchase additional cattle. In the future, with the profits from cattle breeding, they are planning to raise children and significantly increase their herd. Bolotbek A. is seventy-four and married. His wife is housewife and is also a laundress at the local kindergarten. Bolotbek breeds cattle. Together with his wife, he started cattle breeding four years ago with an initial investment of 500 soms. Now, they have increased the number of their cattle to seven. Bolotbek is applying for a loan in order to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the near future, they are planning to significantly increase their herd. Valentina P. is fifty-three and married. She has a daughter and a three-year-old granddaughter. Her daughter lives and works in Bishkek at the carwash. Her granddaughter goes to kindergarten where Valentina works as a kindergarten teacher. Ten years ago, Valentina started breeding cattle with her husband and now they earn 1,500 soms monthly from cattle breeding. With the profits, they have been able to purchase furniture for their house. Valentina is applying for a loan in order to purchase hay for her cattle. In the near future, with the profits from cattle breeding, they are planning to raise their granddaughter and increase their herd. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle and to buy plastic windows for her house

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en: Ainura C. is leader of this group. She is forty-one and married with three sons who are eighteen, fourteen and twelve years old. Her two youngest sons go to school while her elder son studies at an institution of higher education. Ainura’s husband breeds cattle and she helps him. They started cattle breeding four years ago with an initial investment 2,000 soms. Now, reselling some cattle after fattening they earn 5,000 soms per month. Ainura is applying for a loan in order to have sufficient funds to pay the tuition fee at the institution of higher education of her elder son. In the future, after graduation of her son, she is planning to see her son married and to provide an opportunity to receive higher education to her youngest two sons. The other group members are: Aigul S. is treasurer of the group. She is forty-two and married with three children who are twenty, twelve and two years old. Her elder son is a student at an institution of higher education. Her husband is a member of the riot police. Aigul is a teacher at the local school. She is applying for a loan in order to pay for medical treatment for her daughter. In the future, she is planning to cure her daughter and improve the family’s living conditions. Nazgul A. is thirty-three and married with two daughters who are seventeen and fourteen, and a son five years old. Her elder daughter is a student at the university; her second daughter goes to school and her son is at home. Her husband is a dispatcher. Nazgul is a teacher at the local school. She is applying for a loan in order to pay the university tuition fee of her elder daughter. In the near future, she is planning to give all her children an education and improve the family’s living conditions. Damira M. is forty-seven and married. She has four children: her daughters are twenty and seventeen and her sons are fourteen and twelve years old. Her elder daughter works in a sewing workshop while the other children go to school. Damira makes national handicrafts and sews. She started seven years ago with initial investment of 1,000 soms and her monthly income is 4,000 soms. With the help of the profits she has been able to provide her children with higher education. She wants to start cattle breeding in order to have an additional source of income. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase school accessories for her children and to purchase cattle for breeding purposes with the rest. In the future, she wishes to expand her cattle breeding so that she can more easily provide for her family. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. loans.use: To pay her elder son's tuition fees

loans.name: Begaiym's Group

texts.en: Begaiym S. is leader of this group. She is forty-eight and is a widow with two sons. Her elder son is married and lives independently. Begaiym lives with her youngest son who is planning to apply to college this year. Begaiym works as a dishwasher and also breeds cattle with the help of her elder son. She earns 4,750 soms from cattle breeding. Begaiym is applying for a loan in order to purchase more cattle. She is planning to increase the number of her cattle and wants to see her younger son become married. The other group members are: Saltanat T. is treasurer of the group. She is thirty-four and married with five children: her sons are eighteen, fourteen and twelve and her daughters are four and three years old. Her husband is a builder. Saltanat works as a dishwasher but wants to start cattle breeding with the help of her elder sons. Therefore, she is applying for a loan that would allow her to purchase cattle. With the profits from cattle breeding, she is planning to provide for her children and increase the number of her cattle. Rysbek M. is thirty and married with three children: his sons are sixteen and nine years old and his daughter is one year old. His sons go to school and his daughter is at home. His wife is a housewife and helps him. He breeds cattle and his wife sells milk. They started in 2010 with an initial investment of 2,000 soms. Now, they have been able to increase their income to 7,750 soms a month. Rysbek is applying for a loan in order to purchase more cattle for breeding. With the help of the profits, he is planning to increase his herd and provide his children with good higher education. Ularbek B. is twenty-five and married. His wife is a housewife while he breeds cattle. He just started cattle breeding with an initial investment of 2,000 soms. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for further fattening and reselling at a higher price. In the future, he is planning to significantly increase the number of his cattle and improve his family’s living conditions. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som C. I. is a 46-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom province. She is married to Ly Mao, aged 44, and has six children, all of whom are single. The couple work together in the farming business. To help solve their family's financial crisis, two of the children are employed in a garment factory. Som C. I. and her family live in their own house, which breaks down frequently. As a consequence, their living conditions have been affected. In order to resolve this problem, Som C. I. is humbly requesting a loan of $600 to repair her old house.
Note: Mrs. Som C. I. was not available at the time of the photograph, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en: Baktygul A. is leader of this group. She is 51 years old and is a widow. Baktygul sells clothes and her elder sons help her with her business. She started selling clothes seven years ago when she rented a small shop with the help of a loan of 10,000 TJS from Kiva partner, Mol Bulak Finance. Now, she earns 12,000 TJS. With the help of a loan, Baktygul was able to purchase a truck and furniture for her house. Also, she was able to increase her turnover. However, she wishes to increase her business further and this is why she applied for a loan. With the loan Baktygul wants to purchase school uniforms and start a wholesale trade. In the future, she plans to reinvest all her profits in her business. About the other group members: Gulmira T. is treasurer of the group. She is 37, married, and has two children: her son is 16 and her daughter is 13 and both of them go to school. Her husband is an electrician while Gulmira is a nurse at the local hospital. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase furniture for her house. In the future, she is planning to build a house and bathhouse. Kanymbiubiu N. is fifty and a widow with four children: her sons are twenty-five, twenty two and sixteen and her daughter is twenty years old. Her youngest son works in clothing manufacture and her elder daughter is a waitress. Kanymbiubiu sells fish. Before that she was selling meat but three years ago she switched to selling fish. She started selling fish with an initial investment of 360 soms and now she earns 3,000 soms. She has a significant number of patrons and she is able to form very friendly relationships with them. Recently, one of her children was married and Kanymbiubiu therefore spent the most part of her money. Now, she needs some money to continue her business and so she is applying for a loan in order to increase her turnover. In the near future, she is planning to reinvest most part of her profits in her business and also raise her children. Kulnara D. is forty-five and married. She has three children: her sons are nineteen and eighteen years old and her daughter is four years old. Her youngest daughter goes to kindergarten and her elder son is a mason in a boiler room while her second son works for a private entrepreneur who produces confectionery. Kulnara is a worker in a factory that produces alcoholic drinks. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase an automobile for her family. In the future, she plans to open a store focused on selling convenience goods. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. loans.use: To purchase school uniforms to sell and start a wholesale trade

loans.name: Meena's Group

texts.en:
Meena lives in a small, historic city in Pakistan called Pakpattan. She is 40 years old and has given birth to two daughters. Both of them are illiterate as she couldn’t afford to educate them. They are still very young and it is Meena’s desire to enroll them in school.

Meena supports her family by selling shawls (worn over the shoulders, upper body and arms). She purchases the shawls from Faisalabad, a city which is famous for its textile industry, and sells them in her own city at a profit.

Meena’s husband operates a business selling wheat and rice. He buys his stock wholesale and sells it to his clients for a profit. He has been doing this business for past ten years. Meena has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wheat and rice in large quantity.

Meena is confident that her husband has a great sense of business and he will be able to improve his business by making this investment in it. She does hope that, with the increased income, she will be able to send her daughters to school soon. She is a new loan applicant. She is expecting that this loan will be a good and profitable experience for her family.

In the photo, Meena is the lady who has her hand raised.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more wheat and rice to sell

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en: Nurgul S. is leader of this group. She is forty-eight and married with four children: her daughters are twenty two, seventeen and eleven and her son is five years old. Her husband is an ecology inspector. Nurgul sells convenience goods, a business she started twelve years ago with initial investment of 20,000 soms: she purchased a one-room flat and converted it into a shop. Her monthly income is 7,000 soms. With the profits from her business, she has been able to purchase a house and a car. Nurgul is applying for a loan in order to purchase convenience goods to increase her turnover which will also increase her profits. In the future, she is planning to increase her turnover further and give her daughters an opportunity to receive higher education at the institutions of higher education in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. About the other group members: Gulzat Z. is treasurer of the group. She is forty-five and married to a truck driver. She makes and sells national handicrafts for the house. She started her business six years ago with 6,000 soms obtained in the form a loan from microcredit company MCC Mol Bulak Finance. Her monthly income is now 1,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase materials for making more national handicrafts. In the future, she is planning to expand her business. Zheenbiubiu U. is forty-five and married with three sons who are twenty-five, twenty-four and eight years old. Her husband is a teacher at the local music school. Together with other members of her family, Zheenbiubiu runs a business providing music and master-of-ceremonies at various family celebrations and other events. They started their business six years ago with rented musical equipment and now they make 15,000 soms each month. With the profits from their business, they were able to purchase musical equipment, build a house and pay for their son’s marriage. In the near future, with help of their business, they are planning to accomplish the marriage of their second child. Jumagul A. is twenty-six and married with a five-year-old daughter. Jumagul works in a barbershop and her husband went to work in Russia to make money. With the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell. In the future she wants to save money and rent a pavilion in Bishkek and start providing hairdressing services. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. loans.use: To purchase more convenience goods for her store

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Farming crops is a specialist skill that 45-year-old Tin M. learned from her grandparents who died many years ago. Her husband frequently works in the fields alongside her as well as working in the construction sector. Tin M. has seen a plot of land in a good location for farming. She wants to be the owner of this land but her personal savings are not sufficient to buy the land. Therefore, she is asking for a loan so that she can afford to buy the farmland, where she will plant crops to make extra profit.
Mrs. Tin M. is married with two children, both of whom are employed and no longer in school.

loans.use: To buy some farmland

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza B., from the village of Abu, Mambajao, Camiguin Province, is 38 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer, a 35-year-old mother of a 7-year-old daughter, lives in a small town of Pakpattan Pakistan named Hassan Poora. Married to M. I., she resides in a two-room brick house with her family.

Her husband is a private entrepreneur who has dealt with blankets and carpets for the past ten years, buying his products from Lahore and supplying them to various cities including Islamabad and Faisalabad. His customers are very satisfied with him due to the quality of items he sells.

Anwer herself is also a very hardworking and good-natured lady. She runs a small grocery shop adjacent to her home from which she sells daily use items such as tea, sugar, cooking oil, candies and chips. She started this business in order to support her husband financially.

Anwer is now requesting a loan from Asasah for her husband, who plans to buy blankets because the winter season is approaching and he hopes to earn additional profits by making an investment in his business. A new loan applicant of Asasah, Anwer hopes this will be a beneficial experience that will enable her to soon send her daughter to school with the increased income of her husband’s business.

Note: In the picture, Anwer is shown raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase blankets for re-selling

loans.name: Joniban

texts.en:
Joniban O. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Joniban is single. Joniban owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Joniban has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2010 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Joniban joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Joniban is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joniban from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: purchasing fish to sell

loans.name: Busada

texts.en:
Busada M. lives in the Bakai-Ata village, in the heart of Kyrgyzstan. She is 56, married, and has four grown children; her youngest son, in accordance with Kyrgyz national tradition, lives with her and helps in the household. She works as a masseur in a local hospital and is known as a physician who can soon fix a patient up. 

Unfortunately, salaries of medical personnel in rural areas are very low. That s why in 1993, Busada began to engage in stock-breeding by buying milk cows. Also, she started to cultivate a plot of land with kidney-beans and perennial herbs, which serve as concentration of forage for her cattle and ensure a high quality of milk. 

Busada plans to use this loan of 80,000 KGS to buy four milk cows, which will lead to an increase of milk sales, and to purchase mineral fertilizers for her plot of land. With the revenues, Busada plans to renovate her cattle barn to improve her cows' living conditions.

Busada believes that these activities will allow her to achieve prosperity and well-being for her family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: purchasing cattle and fertilizer

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina belongs to a small city of Pakistan called Pakpattan. She is a housewife who spends most of her time staying at home, managing household chores, and taking care of her three-year-old daughter. She lives in a three-room brick house with her family. 

Her husband is A. D.; he is in the timber-selling business. He has been doing this business for the last 10 years and is the only breadwinner of the family. He runs a timber shop in the main market where he sells timbers to his regular customers and others.  

It has become difficult for Zarina to manage with just the income of her husband because her daughter is growing, and her needs will naturally grow as time goes on. Therefore, she has decided to apply for a loan from Asasah for her husband so he can buy timber in bulk and increases his chances of making a profit. 

Zarina hopes that her husband will be able to improve his business with the help of the loan and she will be able to send her daughter into school next year when she will be 4 years old.

This is her first loan from any MFI and she is hopeful that this will become a profitable experience for her family.  

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Zarina.

loans.use: Purchasing timbers for timber selling business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. is a 42-year-old woman that has been blessed with six children, ranging in age from 9 to 19 years old. All of her children are still in school. She and her family live in Botbot, Pandan in the province of Antique. Though their village is far from the market and the main municipality, Eunice never allowed these circumstances hinder her from earning money. 

Eunice wanted to start a fishing business but was unable to do so because there was no business capital to start with. The vision of profiting from this kind of business made her join ASHI in 2004 and get a loan. At that point her fishing business was born, and with the help of her husband, Rolito, she has tried to keep it profitable.

Her husband catches the fish and she sells them around the village and nearby town. She is used to walking through the rough and narrow road covered with trees to earn money for her children and their education. She works despite rain, heat, and fatigue.

With her family and ASHI, Eunice can have her own business which will enable her to send all of her children to school through college, in the hopes that she can give them a better life.

loans.use: To support the maintenance of her fishing business

loans.name: Karen Rose
