Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of cooking oil, meat, fish, beans, etc.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
N. Olivia lives in the Lugala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives). Olivia has a business of a retail kiosk. She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. 

Olivia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baking powder for making chapatti, samosas, and cakes, bans of bread, packed sugar and soap. She also generates additional income through her rentals.

The main business challenge for Olivia is transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are educating her children up to university and improving her standard of living. 

She decided to join MCDT because of the low interest rate. Olivia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: purchasing flour, cakes, bans of bread, sugar, and soap

loans.name: God Gift Group

texts.en:
Martha T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Gift.  She is 40, married, and has six children who are between the ages of ten to 24 years. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For ten years, she has been operating a mini bakery in "Old Road community" outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, eggs, and yeast for her bread making. 

She describes herself as a respectful woman whose goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: buying more bags of flour, sugar, eggs and yeast for bread making

loans.name: Daniel Ondongo

texts.en:
Daniel Ondongo is a businessman. He is 31 years old and married to Ruth Ambonya who is a businesslady who adds to the income of the family. They have one child who is two years old. Daniel manages a garage which is situated at a very busy place where there is a constant flow of customers, at satellite in Nairobi. He has been doing this business for seven years and the profit margin for a month is 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Ondongo has no other history with any other MFI, and he came to learn about KADET microfinance through a KADET marketing strategy at exhibitions. He is applying for his third loan of 90,000 KES with KADET Ltd having successfully repaid the previous loan. He plans to use the loan to buy paints, fillers, and a panel beating machine which are items used mostly in a garage station.

In the future Daniel plans to grow his business in terms of profits in order to raise capital to open another workshop in a place called Kawangware. Also he wants to be able to provide for the essential needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy paints, fillers, panel beating machine

loans.name: Felictus

texts.en:
Felictus K. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children, one of whom is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (granddaughters).

Felictus has a business of selling vegetables. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Felictus sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Felictus has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of vegetables like cabbages, onions, tomatoes and egg plants. The main business challenges for Felictus include seasonality and perishability. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to farmers. Felictus lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and medication.

loans.use: buying fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
This is Melitona P., 58, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Eugenio P. Sr. and mother to three young hard-working adults. By the grace of God, Melitona has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melitona operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling in piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a  minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Melitona dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Makabe Group

texts.en:
Eva K. is in her late twenties. Five years ago she started her own beauty salon which she runs from 8:30 am to 9:00 pm every day. She currently makes a monthly profit of approximately $263.

This will be Eva’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. If Eva is granted a Motisha loan, she will invest in more salon equipment and women’s clothing. Eva’s dream is to expand her business by hiring more employees so that one day she can have a big salon with several people working for her. 

Eva will share this loan with her loan group, Makabe, which has 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Eva is sitting in the front, second from right, wearing brown clothes.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment and clothes

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María es vendedora D. comida, posee un puesto D. venta callejero, es divorciada pero ella sola se ocupa D. criar a tres hijos. Es una clienta conocida D. IMPRO, ya lleva cuatro créditos y solicita su primer crédito con KIVA. Solicita préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción para la refacción D. su vivienda, se acerca la época D. lluvias y ella quiere tomar precauciones. Ella es residente D. la zona D. Villa Yunguyo D. la ciudad D. El Alto.
texts.en:
María has a street stall from which she sells food. She is divorced and raises her three children by herself. She is a well-known client of IMPRO and has already had four loans with them, and is now asking for her first one with Kiva. María is seeking a loan to buy construction material to renovate her home. The rainy season is approaching and she wishes to be prepared for it. She lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Yunguyo in the town of El Alto

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: house repairs

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Florence has a cosmetics store.  She has been in this business for five years, and works six days a week. Florence sells her products in a retail shop. Florence has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of creams and relaxer braids. The main business challenges for Florence include the rainy season and transportation of boxes of cosmetics from Kikuubo in the city of Kampala to her shop in Nakulabye. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked cosmetics shop and a bridal salon. Florence lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio es obrero de una empresa textil, es viudo y tiene dos hijos, la familia posee vivienda propia, solicita su primer crédito tanto en IMPRO como en KIVA para comprar materiales de refacción para su casa, se acercan las lluvias y el lugar necesita con urgencia reparaciones. Lucio es residente de la zona de Villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
Lucio works for a textile company. He is a widower and has two children. The family owns its own house and is seeking its first loan from IMPRO and Kiva to buy construction material to renovate the home. The rainy season is approaching and repairs to the house are urgently needed. Lucio lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Tunari in the town of El Alto.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: house repairs

loans.name: Protea Group

texts.en:
Theresia M., who is in her mid-twenties, is married and has a two-year-old daughter. She runs a food shop and has had the business for one year. She works from 10am to 8pm every day and is able to make a monthly profit of around $32.

This will be Theresia’s sixth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania and she aims to use the loan to increase the shop’s inventory. Her earlier loans were used to open up the shop and to expand the business. She has paid back the previous loans successfully. Telesia’s dream is to start selling her shop products at wholesale prices. She is very happy with her previous loans, which have allowed her to start and expand her own business.

Theresia will share this loan with her loan group, Protea, which has 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

In the picture, Theresia is the second from right in a kitenge (kiswahili "fabric").

loans.use: To increase shop inventory

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es: Gervasio es albañil, es un hombre viudo que debe cuidar a 4 hijos de 5, 7, 9 y 11 años de edad, solicita préstamo para la refacción de su vivienda, específicamente para comprar materiales de construcción, cabe decir que los trabajos los realizará por su cuenta, es decir que él hará las reparaciones en el hogar. El cliente es residente de la Zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto. Gervasio ya tiene 5 créditos con IMPRO,  este es su primer crédito con KIVA.
texts.en:
Gervasio is a bricklayer. He is a widower and has four children aged 5, 7, 9, 11 to raise. He is seeking a loan to repair his house, specifically to buy construction material. Of course, he will do the repairs himself. Gervasio lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Ingenio in the town of El Alto. He has already had five loans with IMPRO, but this is his first with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: house repairs

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 24-year-old dairy farmer. His business is located in Kiambu Kenya and supplies milk to one of the milk processing firms in the area. He also earns extra income through crop farming, and has been doing these businesses for the last three years. John is single and hopes to get more financial support from Faulu Kenya in the future. John is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married to a businessman with two children who all attend school. She has houses for rent and has been operating for the last ten years. Her other source of income is her husband's salary.

With a loan of 30,000 KES she wants to renovate her house and purchase new iron sheeting. Her potential customers are the neighbouring community and city dwellers.

Joyce faces a major challenge of theft in her business. Her major goal is to build a permanent house in the future. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan to modify her business. She lives in her own house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To renovate her house and purchase new iron sheeting

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio está ubicado en el pueblo de Achacachi en comunidad Huanuco. Olivia es productora  de leche, su producción es  entregada a la empresa de lácteos Pil. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera la cual le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche. Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Olivia lives in her parents' home, located in the village of Achacachi in the community of Huanuco. She owns a dairy and sells milk to Pil, a large distributor of dairy products. This is her main source of income. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow which will increase her milk production. This is Olivia's first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cow.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deysi vende productos para adelgazar, tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como funcionario público, desea el crédito para comprar mercadería al mayoreo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde hace tres créditos y solicita su primer crédito a través de KIVA. Ella es residente de la zona de Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, es curioso que al principio ella fuera consumidora de estos productos para después animarse a ser promotora.
texts.en:
Deysi sells weight loss products. She has two children. Her husband works as a government employee. She wants the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. She has been a client of IMPRO for three loans. This is the first loan she has requested through Kiva. She lives in the area of Villa Exaltación in the city of El Alto. It is funny that in the beginning she bought these products, and later she decided to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for work

loans.name: Mega

texts.en: Mega N. lives in the Lugala Kosovo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her brother. Mega has a retail shop. She has been in this business for five years, and works six days a week. Mega sells retail products from her home. Mega has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil. She generates additional income by selling firewood. The main business challenges for Mega include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are seeing her business grow big and starting to sell wholesale only. Mega lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Cristhian Giovanny

texts.es: Cristhian es transportista público, es decir, es un chofer asalariado que cuenta con su propia movilidad. En el plano familiar  tiene dos hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres la cual esta en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Solicita su primer crédito a través de Kiva para la conversión de gasolina a GNV de su herramienta de trabajo, esto le  generará un ahorro del 60% de combustible.
texts.en:
Cristhian works in public transportation. That means that he is a salaried driver who has his own vehicle. In regards to his family, he has two children. They live in his parents’ house, which is in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. He is requesting his first loan with Kiva in order to convert the vehicle he uses for work from gasoline to GNV (natural gas). This will produce a 60% savings on fuel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for conversion from gasoline to natural gas

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Nairobi-based businessman. He sells used men's trousers retail. He describes his business environment as good and gets more income from running a retail shop. At 41-years-old, John is married and a father of one child who is nine years old. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 60,000 to buy bales of used men's trousers to increase stock in his business. He desires to have two more operating branches in five years and hopes to employ one person every year. He has benefitted by being in Faulu Kenya since he has learned much and practices record keeping. He describes himself as hardworking, trustworthy and visionary.

loans.use: Purchasing bales of men's trousers

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio está ubicado en Achacachi  en la comunidad Arasaya. Tiene dos hijos que aún son dependientes.  Con su esposa trabajan como productores de leche y agricultura, está es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera la cual le permitirá entregar mayor cantidad de leche. Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in his own house, which is located in the Arasaya community in Achacachi. He has two children who are still dependents. He and his wife work as milk producers and farmers. This is the primary source of income to support his family. The loan is to buy a dairy cow. This will allow him to deliver a greater quantity of milk. This is his first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 45 years old, and married with three children in school.  He earns a living by selling second-hand clothes. He has been running the business for 22 years. He registered to be a member of Faulu Kenya under the River Bank group. He now earns a better income, thanks to Faulu Kenya's financial support through loans. He has requested for a loan of 60,000 KES to buy six bales of blouses. He hopes to expand his business and help other people to stabilize.

loans.use: To buy six bales of blouses

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
S. Mohammed, who is in his mid-thirties, is married with three children: one son and two daughters. He owns a food stall from which he sells homemade food, soda, milk, water and juice. He has been running this business for 15 years. The stall is open daily from 7 a.m. until midnight. His business earns him a good monthly profit.

This will be S.’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. S.’s goal with this loan is to increase his stock of beverages. He believes that the combined sales of drinks and food will increase his profits.

S. will share the loan with his loan group, Uwezesho, which has 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loans.

In the picture, S. is the first on the right, in the front.

loans.use: To increase his stock of beverages

loans.name: Joaquin Luis

texts.es:
Joaquín vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto en la zona Brasil. Joaquín es costurero, está es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. Su taller queda en su propio domicilio, vive con sus dos hijos, su esposa se fue por motivos de trabajo a España con el objetivo de reunir dinero para comprar una casa propia. 

El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de trabajo, tela ligas e hilos. Esto le permitirá aumentar su mercadería. Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Joaquín lives in his parents’ house in the Brasil area of the city of El Alto. Joaquín is a tailor, and this is the primary source of income for his family. His shop is in his own home. He lives with his two children. His wife went to Spain for work. Her objective is to get together money to buy their own house. The loan is to buy work materials like fabric, elastics, and thread. This will allow him to increase his merchandise. This is his first loan with Impro. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Delia Lourdes

texts.es:
Delia vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto en la zona Alto lima.  Delia es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de papa y chuño, está es su principal fuente de ingresos. 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de mercadería. Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Delia lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto. Delia is a merchant, and she sells potatoes and “chuño” (freeze-dried potato). This is her primary source of income. The loan is to buy merchandise. This is her first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a Kiambu-based businessman who sells meat in his butchery. He has been running this business for the past ten years and serves area residents. At 43 years of age, Julius also sells used clothes to earn extra income. He is married and is a father of three ranging between 4 and 20 years of age. He was formerly employed as a butcher and hopes to build his own shop and open another business in five years. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to increase the stock of meat in his butchery. He describes himself as consistent, hardworking and determined.

loans.use: Adding stock of meat

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen M. lives in the Lugala Kosovo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  She changed her business enterprise from charcoal selling to a retail shop a few months ago.  She works seven days a week.  Allen sells her products in a retail shop. Allen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil. She generates additional income through selling fruit. The main business challenges for Allen include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are seeing her business grow big, starting to sell wholesale only, and also building rental rooms. Allen lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more soap, salt, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Agueda se dedica ala cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de leche es vendida a la planta PIL ANDINA, su marido le ayuda con el cuidado del ganado, él hace trabajos esporádicos como albañil. Agueda solicita 1000 dólares para la compra de ganado. Este es su primer crédito con IMPRO  y el primero con Kiva. La pareja tiene cinco hijos y radican en el Departamento de La Paz.
texts.en:
Agueda raises milking cows. The milk she gathers is sold to a company named Pil Adina. Her husband helps her care for the cattle and he also takes on construction contracts. Agueda requests a loan in the amount of 1000 dollars to purchase livestock. This will be her first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner). The couple have five children together and they live in the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es: Cipriano es viudo y esta cargo de dos hijas pequeñas, solicita su primer crédito, tanto en IMPRO como en KIVA para la compra de ganado vacuno, él se dedica a la cría y vende leche a la planta PIL ANDINA. La familia radica en el departamento de La Paz.
texts.en:
Cipriano is a widow and he has his two little girls in his care. He requests a first loan from Impro (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase milking cows. He raises milking cows and sells the milk he gathers a company named Pil Andina. The family lives in the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto en la zona Villa Bolívar “c”. Tiene dos hijos, su esposo realiza perforaciones de tierra. Patricia se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, está es su principal fuente de ingresos. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de mercadería. Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Patricia lives wither her parents. Their residence is located in the city of El Alto, in the Villa Bolívar “C” area. She has two children. Her husband does ground drilling. Patricia sells clothing; this is her main source of income. The loan will be used to purchase clothing. This is her first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tarr’S Group

texts.en:
Esther B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called T.’s Group.  She is 55 years old, married, and has nine children who are between the ages of 15 to 36 years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For ten years, she has been selling rice, beans, cooking oil and fish in the “Old Road” Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 69,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, and beans. 

She describes herself as an easy-going woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, meat, fish and beans

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es agricultora y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de leche es vendida a la planta PIL ANDINA. Tiene un hijo que es veterinario y su codeudor, además es el único que la asiste ya que sus otros hijos viven lejos, además ella enviudó hace tiempo. Solicita su primer crédito en KIVA para la compra de ganado vacuno. Ella vive en el departamento de La Paz.
texts.en:
Carmen is a farmer and also works raising dairy cows and selling the milk to the Pil Andina factory. She has a son who is a veterinarian and her partner in the loan. He is the only person who helps her out since her other children live far away and she was widowed some time ago. She is asking for her first loan through Kiva to buy dairy cows. She lives in the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a 26 year old single man who operates his business in Nairobi. He stocks electronics, mobile phones, accessories and chargers. He employs five people who help him run this business and a retail shop in another location within Nairobi. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add to his stock of mobile phones, accessories and chargers. He describes himself as intelligent and hopes to control a large market share in his region and diversify his operations.

loans.use: Buying more mobile phones, accessories and chargers

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban vive en anticrético cuyo domicilio está ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz en la zona de Pasankeri. Tiene  dos hijos y su esposa realiza bordados de trajes de baile. Esteban trabaja en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa como chofer propietario. Está es su principal fuente de ingresos. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de un motor y caja de cambios para reparar su vehículo. Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Esteban lives in a rented home located in the city of La Paz in the Pasankeri neighborhood. He has 2 children and his wife works embroidering dance outfits. Esteban works in public transportation as a driver. He has his own vehicle and drives on routes organized by the Eduardo Avaroa union. This is his main source of income. With the loan, he will buy a motor and a gear box to repair his vehicle. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a motor

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan y su esposa son padres de dos hijos. El cliente se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de leche es vendida a la planta PIL ANDINA. Su segundo ingreso proviene de trabajos eventuales de albañilería pero esto no es suficiente, por eso, necesita su primer crédito en KIVA para comprar una vaca lechera. IMPRO ha fomentado las actividades comerciales de Juan unas tres veces.
texts.en:
Juan and his wife are parents to two children. This customer makes a living raising dairy cattle and the milk is sold to the PIL ANDINA plant. He earns a second income with occasional masonry work. This isn't enough so he needs his first Kiva loan to purchase a dairy cow. IMPRO has helped with Juan's business three times already.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with three children: one boy and two girls, all of whom attend school. She has been operating her own restaurant for the last five years, selling from a shop and also from home to passersby and neighbours. She earns her other income from her husband's shop.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, soft drinks, and kitchen utensils. Her major challenges in the business are competition and theft. She hopes to own a shop in future.

Khadija decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to improve her standard of living. She rents a home with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, clothing, and rent.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, soft drinks. and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 30-year-old businessman who sells bananas in Nairobi. He has been running this business for the last three years in an environment he terms "conducive". He employs four people in his business and also runs a retail shop for extra income. He is a father of two and describes himself as himself as competent and hardworking. He is requesting for a loan of KES 40,000 to add to his stock of bananas for sale.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is 23 years old and single. He practices dairy farming to earn a living. He sells milk to the Fresha Company (a well-known milk processing plant in Kenya). He also runs a retail shop to boost his income. He is a registered member of Faulu Kenya in the Gathaithi group. With his first loan from Faulu Kenya, he bought a dairy cow. He is now requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy another cow. He hopes to have more cows and become a famous dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 44 years old and a single mother of one. Her child is 27 years old and not in school. Jane earns her income from dairy farming. She has been engaged in the business for the past five years, and has been able to employ one person in her business. Jane also does horticultural farming for more income. She was previously employed before she went into business. She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to buy a cow. She sees herself buying a plot and building a house in a few years.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 22 years old and a member of the Twaweza group in Faulu Kenya. He sells bananas in the Gikomba open-air market. He has three years of experience in running the business. He says that he is a hardworking man who hopes to expand his business. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more bananas.

loans.use: To buy bananas.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline C. is a married woman with two sons, both of whom attend school. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, rent and clothing.

Everline has been operating her tailoring business for the last seven years. She sells her finished products in a shop and from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Her other source of income is her husband’s salary. Her major challenges are local competition and seasonality.

Everline decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans and improve her business. With 40,000 KES she wants to purchase more cloth. She hopes to have her own shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Piedra Preciosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Piedra Preciosa lo conforman Ana Mercedes Sandobal de 49 años desde 2004 instalo inicio con la venta de chiverías luego con los prestamos fue invirtiendo en otros productos hasta tener una pequeña venta completa. Esta señora tiene la meta convertir su modesta venta en una miscelánea.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Yesenia C.  quien vende comida hace 5 años y Magda F. vende leña hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The group Piedra Preciosa (Precious Stone) was formed by Ana Mercedes Sandobal, who is 49 years old. Since 2004, she has worked selling snacks. Later, with loans, she invested in other products until she had a complete small shop. This lady has a goal to convert her modest store into a small general store. The other members of the group are Yesina C., who has spent 5 years selling food, and Magda F. who has sold wood for 7 years.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For basic grains, meat, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard F. M. is a 34-year-old married man with a three-year-old child. For the past five years he has been running a matatu (van) transport business. He is able to employ two people in this venture. He also owns and runs a shop where he sells spare parts.

Benard believes that he will see a change in his business after taking out his first loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya. With the loan proceeds he will paint his van, repair the seats and buy spare parts for his shop. He hopes to own more matatus in the future.

loans.use: To paint his van, repair the seats and buy spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Jorge Miguel

texts.es:
Don Jorge tiene 22 años de edad, reside en la colonia Satélite de San Miguel,  el es casado y vive con su esposa posee un negocio de venta de celulares, accesorios, reparación y venta de saldo, ubicado en San Francisco Gotera, El negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia en vista de ser un mercado potencial.
El actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de equipo para la reparación de celulares.
Este crédito ayudara a que don Jorge mejore su negocio ya que al adquirir el equipo que necesita él estará brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así aumentaran sus ventas.
Su sueño es manejar un negocio estable a largo plazo, que le ayude a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 22 years old and resides in the Satellite neighborhood of San Miguel. He is married and lives with his wife. Jorge possesses a business, located in San Francisco Gotera, selling cellular phones and accessories, doing repairs and offering remnant sales. He began the business from his own initiative because he saw the business potential. Now, Jorge is soliciting a loan to buy equipment for repairing cellular phones. The loan will help Jorge improve his business by acquiring the equipment he needs to offer better service to his customers and, thus, increase sales. His dream is to manage a stable business in the long run, which will help him improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO OFFER CELLULAR PHONES, ACCESSORIES, REPAIRS, AND REMNANT SALES

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Nueva Esperanza” esta en el 1er. Ciclo del Programa comité de Mujeres en la ciudad de Limpio. 
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, también se dedica al trabajo de servicios como la empleada domestica.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Nélida quien se dedica a la venta de sabanas. 
Ella coloca sus mercaderías preferentemente a crédito ya que fácil con ese método.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad en sus horas libres ya es ama de casa, pero nos comenta que es muy importante para ella vender sus mercadería ya que con el mismo cuenta con un ingreso propio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sabanas.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza committee is in the first stage of the Comite de Mujeres program in the city of Limpio. All the members of the committee work in different fields such as, sales, food preparation and maid services. The members have formed a tight-knit group able to engage in joint activities that enhance their relationships. One of the members is Nelida, sells sheets. She usually sells her goods on credit which makes it easier. She does this in her free time since she is a homemaker. She tells us that it is very important for her to sell these goods since she earns her own income. She is requesting a loan to buy sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

Nancy has been operating a tailoring business for the last ten years. She sells her wares from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are competition and seasonality.

Nancy wishes to work with Yehu so she will have access to its loans and improve her business. With 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more cloth. She hopes to own a shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Faustino de 50 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de María es la primera en abrirse en su pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 23 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir, pero sabe que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa. Con el tiempo anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and is a very cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Faustino, who is 50 years old, and their 3 dear children to whom they wish to offer a better quality of life. María's store is the first to open its doors every morning. Starting at 6 am she is ready to receive her early morning shoppers who appreciate the variety of merchandise that she offers in her store. They don't have any doubts about shopping at her store since they are sure that they are going to find what they need. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers and finding out what is going on in the village. She has been running her store for 23 years, however, the most difficult part of her job is having to stay in the store all day without being able to leave. She knows, however, that sacrifice has its rewards. In time, she would like to see her business grow and to offer her customers better service. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She expects to make her payments on time since she doesn't want to cause problems for the other members in her communal bank where she is very respected because of the discipline she brings to the group. With the five hundred nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting, she will buy more products to better manage her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Amina J., who is in her mid-thirties, is married with three daughters. For the past four years she has operated a second-hand shop, and currently earns a monthly profit of around $100.

This will be Amina’s second Mothisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Amina spent her previous loan on school fees, a loan which she has fully repaid. She now hopes for a loan to keep her business running and to put some money in the bank for use later on.

Amina, shown in the front row on the right, will share this loan with her loan group, Ari-Mypya, which totals nine members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

loans.use: To keep her business running and save some money in the bank.

loans.name: Koffi Benjamin

texts.fr: ce monsieur a ouvert en 2008, sa boutique de vente d'articles de quincaillerie, ce commerce est rentable au togo car la population ne cesse de croître et il y par conséquent des besoins d'habitation. il s'approvisionne au ghana voisin et à lomé. la demande de sa clientèle est de plus en plus élevé, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour s'approvisionner en articles de quincaillerie.Il est marié et père d'un enfant.
texts.en:
This gentleman opened his hardware store in 2008. This is a profitable business in Togo as the population is still growing, and with it, the need for housing. He gets his stocks in neighboring Ghana, and also in Lomé. With customer demand increasing steadily, he is seeking a loan from WAGES to stock up on hardware items. He is married and the father of one child.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware store supplies

loans.name: God With Us Group

texts.en:
David K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'God With Us'.  He is 26 years old, single, and has one child who is seven years old. He was only able to attend school through eleventh grade due to financial constraints. 

For seven years, he has been selling used clothes on Mechlin Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. He describes himself as a hard-working man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Agarthar

texts.en: Agarthar M. is a baker at Elmina. Agarthar has no educational background.  She is divorced. Agarthar has been a baker for seven years. She is able to take care of herself with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of flour and other ingredients to bake for distribution to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy an extra oven for her baking.

loans.use: buy additional bags of flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Esmeralda es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, hace varios años se divorcio y ella sola mantiene  su hijo y a su mama, la señora Esmeralda quiere lo mejor para su familia y quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que requiere de este crédito ya que quiere terminar un cuarto que ya tiene empezado. Poco a poco le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su vivienda, pero quiere terminar el cuarto ya que lo habitara su hijo adolescente.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a mother and a very hard working person. Many years ago she divorced and she supports her son and her mother. Esmeralda wants the best for her family and she want to provide them with a better quality of life. She requires a loan to finish building a partially completed room in their house. Slowly she has been improving their home but she wants to have this room completed for her adolescent son.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a room in her house.

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr: folly exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de bouteilles de gaz, il fait ce commerce depuis 2006 et s'approvisionne au port autonome de Lomé. il expose ses marchandises au bord de la route pour attirer le regard des passants. actuellement consommation de gaz des ménages est forte, il veut saisir cette opportunité pour maximiser son profit c'est pour cette raison qu'il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une douzaine de bouteilles de gaz
texts.en:
Folly has a revenue-generating business involving bottled gas. He has been in this business since 2006 and gets his supplies at the Autonomous Port of Lomé. He displays his merchandise on the roadside to draw the attention of those passing by. Currently, household gas consumption is high. Folly wants to seize this opportunity to maximize his profit. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying a dozen bottles of gas.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bottled gas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: United Family Group

texts.en:
Wesseh T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United Family'.  He is 38 years old, single, and has three children who are between the ages of two to nine years. He was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For eight years, he has been selling “torch lights” (push lights) on Benson Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 12,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 48,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more “torch light”. He describes himself as a hard-working man whose dream is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more torch lights to sell

loans.name: The Mothers Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Madres está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Darling del Socorro Dávila Monje, coordinadora del grupo, quien comercializa anteojos de sol y accesorios desde hace seis años. Ella sueña con mejorar su casa y que su negocio crezca.

Las integrantes del grupo son Fátima del Socorro Méndez Alvarado  comerciante de cosméticos y perfumes y Heyling Sugey Jirón P. realiza y vende pasteles  desde hace cuatro años negocio con el que piensa prosperar tener una mejor vivienda y proporcionarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The group named "The Mothers" is made up of three hard working women. One of the members is Darling del Socorro D. Monje. She is the coordinator of the group and she has been selling sunglasses and accessories for the past six years. She dreams of improving her home and making her business grow. The members of the group are: Fatima del Socorro Mendez Alvarado, she sells cosmetics and perfumes. Heyling Sugey J. Perez has been selling cakes for the past four years. With her business she hopes to improve her home and to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sunglasses and accessories.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells fish at Elmina. Aba has not received any form of education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a petty trader. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: cette femme est  très dynamique, à 32 ans elle gagne sa vie en exerçant comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de tissus, elle  exerce son activité au grand marché de hedzranawoé qui constitue en même temps son lieu d'approvisionnement. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. actuellement la rentrée scolaires approche et elle souhaite se réapprovisionner pour accroître ses recettes dans cette période c'est pour cette raison qu'elle demande chez WAGES son tout premier crédit. elle a une personne à sa charge.
texts.en:
This woman is very dynamic. At 32 years of age, she earns her living by operating a fabric sales business. She runs her business at the large market in Hedzranawoé which is also where she gets her supplies. Her clientele is composed of all people. Currently the beginning of the school year is approaching and she wants to restock in order to bolster her revenue during this period. It is for this reason that she is requesting her very first loan from WAGES. She supports one other person.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Maria Enedelia

texts.es: La Señora María Enedelia es pensionada, enviudo desde hace muchos años, vive con ella uno de sus hijos, el cual trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, con el pago de su pensión le han hecho muchas mejoras a su vivienda, pero en esta ocasión les hace falta mas dinero para colocar el Vitro piso de uno de los cuartos de la casa, La señora María esta muy agradecida por la ayuda que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Maria Enedelia is retired and she was widowed many years ago. One of her sons still lives with her but he works and contributes towards the household expenses. She has carried out a number of improvements to her home with her pension but she is lacking some resources to install tile flooring in one of the rooms in the house. Maria is very grateful for the support she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring.

loans.name: Martina Janett

texts.es: Martina Janet tiene 36 años, ella se dedica a un bar y comedor. Hace más de 2  años que tiene este negocio, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su comedor está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad y por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado salir adelante pues no es la primera vez que ha realizado financiamientos. Ella ofrece diferentes platillos variados en donde sus clientes escogen el que más les gusta muchos asisten a su local por es un lugar familiar. Este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, gaseosas,  pollo, carnes entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Martina Janet is 36 years old and she runs a restaurant bar. She has had this business for more than 2 years. She is a single mother and she has her son in her care. Her restaurant is located in the outskirts of the city and it is thanks to past loans that she has been able to advance. This is not the first time she has received a loan. She has various foods in her menu to offer clients. Many people help out in her restaurant as it is a family setting. This loan will be used to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, chicken, meats and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa A. is married and takes care of six dependents. She has received junior high education.  Abenawa prepares 'banku'  (a food staple consisting of fermented corn dough) for sale at Elmina. She has been in this 'banku' business for six years. Abenawa uses her earnings from her sales to help her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. Abenawa will use the loan to purchase extra bags of corn and other ingredients for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abenawa plans to save to invest into the sale of provisions.

loans.use: purchase extra bags of corn and other ingredients for sale

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Omar de 36 años, y sus 2 queridos hijos Daisy de 16 y Luis de 7 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Miriam se dedica, es el cultivo de espinacas, lechugas y arvejas. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Ella vende sus cultivos en el mercado de Tarma, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas de insectos que afectan y perjudican la cosecha. En adelante, sembrará en casi toda la extensión de sus campos para aumentar su producción y por ende obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que el crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Miriam, 34, is a cheerful, unassuming woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Omar, 36, and their two beloved children, Daisy, 16 and Luis, 7, to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Miriam grows spinach, lettuce and peas. She goes out every day very early to work her fields because she knows that the money she gets when she sell her crops depends to a great deal on the quality of her products. She sells her products in Tarma’s market because that’s where she’s paid the best. What she enjoys the most about her work is harvesting because that’s when she sees the fruits of long months of labor. She has been farming for 16 years and considers the most difficult part of it to protect her crops from insect infestations that damage the crops. In the future she will plant on nearly her total available area in order to increase production and earn higher income. This is her first loan with MFP. She states that the loan will be very beneficial for her work’s progress. She is very well liked in the communal bank because she is very supportive of the other members. She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy manure for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama K. is married to a petty trader and has three children. She has no educational background. Ama sells costume jewelry by moving from one area to another at Elmina. She has been selling jewelry for eight years now. Ama uses her income to help her husband in taking care of the entire needs of the family. Ama will use the loan to purchase extra assorted jewelry for sale. Ama dreams of building a shop to display her goods should there be any form of increase as a result of the loan.

loans.use: purchase extra assorted costume jewelry for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of slippers

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La Señora Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”,  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene  02 hijos,   la señora estudió  hasta 5to de  educación secundaria.

La señora Paula esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 meses como grupo mientras tanto y en la actualidad como Banco Comunal,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al M.M. R.  fue de S/. 400.00  nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de artefactos electrodomésticos,  también cuenta que vende papa y chuño y artículos diversos en forma ambulatoria.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará un nuevo   crédito S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar papa, chuño y chifleria  (artículos diversos), para que  crezca el  negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener capital propio y mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y las capacitaciones que se dan.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the “Las Perlas II” (The Pearls II) communal bank, located in the district and province of Huancané, within the Puno department. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She has a junior high school education. Paula has been working with the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” (Manuela Ramos Movement), now a communal bank, for eight months. She tells us that her first loan through MMR was for 400 PEN, which she used as working capital for her small domestic appliance business. She also tells us that she also sells potatoes and other tubers and different other things on foot. She is asking for a new loan of 500 PEN ($200) which she will use to buy potatoes, tubers and natural medicines (various items) in order to grow her business. Her dream is to have her own capital and improve her business in the future. What she enjoys most about her communal bank are the meetings with her fellow members and the training they give one another.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: Narciso, de 53 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su madre Manuela de 94 años, a quien cuida y desea brindarles una mejor vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Narciso es la cerrajería, su negocio es muy concurrido ya que es de los pocos que se dedica a esta actividad en su pueblo, todos los días desde muy temprano empieza a atender a sus clientes, quienes conociendo la buena calidad de sus trabajos, no dudan en encomendarle el arreglo de sus cerrojos. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ayudar a sus clientes cuando pierden sus llaves. En adelante, espera seguir trabajando con las mismas fuerzas, con el único fin de sobresalir en la vida. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas herramientas, para desempeñar mejor su labor.
texts.en:
Narciso, 53, is a hard working, unassuming man. He lives in a rented house with his 94-year-old mother, Manuela, whom he cares for and for whom he wishes to provide a better life. Narciso is a locksmith. His business is very busy because he’s one of the few in his town who does this kind of work. He starts to tend to customers very early every day. Those who know the good quality of his work don’t hesitate to trust him with their lock repairs. He has been in this business for 20 years. What he likes best about it is helping his customers when they misplace their keys. In the future he’d like to continue working with the same energy, his only goal being to succeed in life. This is his first loan with MFP. He knows that he has to repay on time if he wants to be able to access future loans. He is a responsible member of his communal bank always concerned for the group’s wellbeing. He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy tools that will help him do his job better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools to better do his metalwork.

loans.name: Rosa Eliana

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Perlas II”  ubicado en la provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la señora estudió educación superior completo.

La señora Rosa esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses como grupo mientras tanto y en la actualidad como Banco Comunal,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para su negocio de  venta de  abarrotes.

En la actualidad la señora  solicitará un nuevo  crédito S/. 600.00 nuevos soles dinero que le servirá para comprar más insumos para su tienda de abarrotes.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una estabilidad segura, por lo que necesita incrementar su capital y hacer crecer  el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la responsabilidad y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Las Perlas II” (The Pearls II) communal bank, located in the district and province of Huancané, within the Puno department. She is a 41 year old single mother and has one son. She has a high school education. Rosa has been working with the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” (Manuela Ramos Movement), as a group and now a communal bank, for eight months. She tells us that her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used as working capital for her grocery business. This time she is requesting a loan of 600 PEN ($225), which will allow her to buy more merchandise for her grocery store. She wants to have secure stability and she needs to increase her capital and grow her business. What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is its members’ responsibility and timeliness.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Las Doncellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Doncellas está conformado por tres féminas una de ellas es Blanca Ivonne Solórzano O. inicio adquiriendo celulares al crédito ahora con los prestamos aumento su capital y ahora puede comprarlos lo cual le deja mayores ganancias. Ella es madre y padre de sus cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 12 y 11 años respectivamente.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Noelia L. S. quien vende sopa y fritanga e Irma I. O. comerciante de plata y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Doncellas group is made up of three females, one of which is Blanca Ivonne Solórzano O.. She began by acquiring cell phone on credit, but now with the loans, she has increased her capital and can now purchase them, leaving her with better earnings. She is the mother and father of her four children who are 15, 13, 12, and 11 years old.

The other group members are Noelia L. S., who sells soup and fritanga food, and Irma I. O., who sells silver and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cell phones

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrea Xiomara

texts.es: Andrea Xiomara tiene 31, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de combustible, hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que esta actividad se dio con la intención, de sufragar los gastos del hogar no es el primer financiamiento que realiza pues ha sido muy importante para ella mantener su negocio activo. A pesar de que su Papa ha tenido problemas  de salud, ha buscado la forma de brindar una muy buena atención a sus clientes. Este financiamiento es para la compra combustible pues actualmente tiene una gran demanda.
texts.en:
Andrea Xiomara is 31 years old. For the past 4 years she has been buying and selling fuel for a living. She started this business with the intention of defraying her household expenses. This is not her first loan. The previous loans have been very helpful in keeping her business going. In spite of the fact that her father has had health problems, she is constantly looking for ways to provide good customer service. This loan will be used to buy fuel that is currently in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fuel to supply her customers

loans.name: Normal Days Group

texts.en:
Yamah R., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Normal Days.  She is 46 years old, married, and has seven children who are between the ages of 10 and 30. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. She cares for six siblings.

For 18 years, she has been selling charcoal in Pipeline Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. 
She describes herself as a friendly woman whose dream is to improve her business and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Rolando de 42 años y sus 4 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Los hermosos campos del poblado natal de Norma, han sido en su vida el lugar que la ha visto crecer y formar su familia, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio, es así que pone en práctica todos sus conocimientos con respecto al cultivo y cosecha de espinacas, zanahorias y lechugas. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Norma, 36, is a very cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her husband, Rolando, 42, and their four young children, for whom she wants to offer a better future. Norma has lived her entire life in the beautiful fields of her native village. She has seen her family form and grow there. From a young age, her parents taught her to work on the farm and now she has her own lands where she works with much dedication and sacrifice. She puts into practice all her knowledge about the cultivation and harvesting of spinach, carrots, and lettuce. It takes 10 years to complete this process and she believes that the most difficult part is to transport the crops to the wholesale market, Tarma, where they are sold. Over time, she would like to buy new land to increase production. This is Norma's first loan with MFP and she knows she has the responsibility to complete all her payments on time and is prepared to do so. Within the community bank, she always keeps herself informed of all the business agreements that the group has reached. With the 1000 soles that she has requested, Norma will buy more fertilizer to improve her crop yields.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: El Señor Fabián, es muy trabajador y su esposa la Señora Sonia también es muy trabajadora, ellos trabajan en una maquiladora de la localidad, como obreros, tienen dos hijos pequeños, ellos adquirieron una casa de interés social, ellos saben que ese será el patrimonio para sus hijos. El señor Fabián, quiere una mayor seguridad para su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con barda en la parte trasera de la vivienda, es para eso que solicitan este préstamo, para empezar la contracción de una barda y así sentirse mucho mas seguros el y su familia.
texts.en:
Fabian is a hard working person and his wife Sonia is also a very hard worker. They are workers in a factory in their region. They have two small children. They acquired a home from social housing and they know that this will be their children's inheritance. Fabian wishes to improve their home for greater security. The house doesn't have a back wall, for which reason he requests a loan. He would like to start building that wall, to feel greater safety and security for himself and for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa E. produces palm kernel oil for distribution at Elmina.  Adjoa has received junior high education. She is married and has been selling palm kernel oil for five years now. She contributes to the household by paying electricity bills. Her loan will be used to more palm fruit to process for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a store house for her oils.

loans.use: buy more palm fruit to process for sale

loans.name: Aqueliza

texts.es: Aqueliza, D. 54 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Florencio D. 50 años y sus 5 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Para Aqueliza las abejas es una fuente D. ingresos económicos, ya que gracias a la miel que ellas producen, pueD. llevar el dinero necesario para mantener a su familia, tiene 1 año en esta actividad y la miel que venD. es rápidamente comprada por sus clientes a quienes provee con este delicioso néctar. Ella Disfruta D. su trabajo, ya que cuando tiene hambre no duda en abrir unos D. sus recipientes D. plástico y saborear el producto que venD., pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar tanto durante todo el día para vender su producto, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar duro y espera poder abrir un negocio más estable. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y se siente en la responsabilidad D. hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy solidaria y preocupada. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, planea incrementar su capital D. trabajo y comprar más miel.
texts.en:
Aqueliza is 54 years old. She is a very unpretentious and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband Florencio, 50 years old, and their 5 young children. She wishes to proviD. them with a better quality of life. Aqueliza has an apiary and it is a source of income and thanks to the honey they produce she has been able to earn enough money to support the family. She has one year in the business. She sells the honey very quickly, a product highly sought out by her clients. She really enjoys her work especially because when she feels hungry all she needs to do is open one of the plastic recipients and eat her product. Her least favorite part is having to walk long distances to sell the product. She knows she has to work hard and one day be able to open a more stable business. This is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is aware of the responsibilities of the loan and she is ready to fulfill them. She is a very attentive and involved member in her community bank. With the five hundred nuevos soles she requests she plans on supplementing her working capital to purchase more honey.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase honey.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo de 46 años, vive en una casa en compañía de sus 3 hijos, habitan en una humilde morada. Recuerda cómo empezó su negocio con muy pocos productos desde hace 7 años que se dedica a esta pulpería, vende sus productos al por menor cada y dice que así gana regulares ganancias. Además le gusta bastante su trabajo porque le permite generarse buenas ganancias que le alcanzan para brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos  pues como todo padre responsable  tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 46 years old and he lives in his house together with his 3 children. They live in a humble home. He remembers the days when he started his business with only very few products. But it has been 7 years now that he has his grocery store. He sells products in retail every day so he has a steady source of income. He really enjoys his work because he is able to earn a good income, enough to provide only the best for his children. As every with every responsible parent he works very hard to advance. His plans are to invest the requested loan in the purchase of greater quantities of merchandise to offer a wider variety of products to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Irma Janeth

texts.es: La señora Irma Yaneth  trabaja en una farmacia de la localidad y su esposo el Señor José Ángel trabaja como Taxista, ellos tienen tres hijos, y viven en una casa de interés social, lo que ellos quieren es ampliar la casa para la mayor comodidad de sus hijos, ya que cada uno requiere de su privacidad, ellos han logrado reunir con ahorros una cantidad para empezar la constricción de un cuarto mas en la casa, pero saben que con ese dinero no van a terminar la construcción, es por eso que requieren de este préstamo y de su ayuda.
texts.en:
Irma Yaneth works in a pharmacy in her region and her husband, Jose Angel, is a taxi driver. They have three children together and they live in a house acquired through social housing. What they would like to do is to expand their home to provide greater comfort to their children, each one needs their privacy. With their own savings they have managed to start the construction of a room in the house but they know that they will not be able to complete with their own funds. For this reason they are requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom.

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en:
R. W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Our God Is Able.  He is 31 years old, married, and has one child who is six years old. He was only able to attend school through twelfth grade due to financial constraints. 

For 10 years, he has been sewing garments and school uniforms in the Red Light Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cloth. 
He describes himself as a good man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cloth.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 30 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Flor de 28 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Juan, es la siembra de papa y choclo, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus chacras de la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, pero para mejorar sus ganancias desea comprarse un auto, con el cual él mismo pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará insumos para proteger sus siembra de la plaga de insectos.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old; he is a very loving father and a hard working person. He lives in his own home together with his wife Flor, 28 years old, and their two beloved children. He hopes to provide them with a better quality of life. Juan business is cultivating potatoes and corn. When the harvest has been collected he sells his products to wholesalers in the city of Tarma, where he already has various clients. His clients don't hesitate to wait to buy his entire stock of product because of the high quality he consistently provides. What he most likes about his work is planting seeds in his fields and to cultivate them. He has 15 years experience in his business. The most difficult part is having to ward insects away from the fields. In the future he hopes to keep selling his products but he would like to improve his earnings to be able to afford a car. He will be able to transport his products himself. This is his eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He knows that he must make his payments on time if he wishes to have access to any future loans. He is a very responsible and engaged member in his community bank. With the three thousand nuevos soles that he requests he will purchase pesticides for his plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pesticides.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. sells palm kernel oil, cassava and plantain at Elmina.  Abena has received senior high education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a petty trader. She responsibly supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to purchase additional palm kernels to process for sale. She plans on reinvesting her profit back into her business. 

To prepare her palm kernel oil, she begins by shelling the palm nuts. The shelling used to be performed using two stones to crack each nut and separating the kernel and shell simultaneously. This manual operation is an old-fashioned method by which nuts were cracked. But thanks to machines, we now use nut-cracking machines instead.

The traditional oil extraction method is to simply heat the dried nuts to release the palm kernel oil. The released oil is occasionally skimmed from the top as the heat is applied. This process is continued until almost all the oil is skimmed out of the palm kernel.

loans.use: purchase additional palm kernels to process for sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan F. y su esposa María de Jesús, tienen una muy bonita familia, solo tiene un hijo adolescente, que estudia. El señor Juan trabaja todo el día y la Señora María trabaja en una estancia infantil. Los dos quieren lo mejor para su hijo y es por eso que necesitan este crédito para construir un cuarto mas en su vivienda. Ellos han logrado reunir un dinero de sus ahorros pero no es suficiente para toda la construcción. La familia del Señor Juan les agradece el apoyo.
texts.en:
Juan F. and his wife Maria de Jesus have a beautiful family. They have only a teenage boy who is going to school. Juan works all day and Maria works in a daycare. They both want only the best for their son, for which reason they need a loan to build a room in their house. They have managed to save some money from their own earnings but it is not enough to complete the project. Juan and his family are grateful for the support.
