She also has a few small rooms available for rent. Thanks to these small businesses, she is able to move her children forward. Felicia has a store where she sells clothing for adults and children. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her retail clothing business.

Felicia is grateful to everyone who made this dream possible, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her clothing store

loans.name: Flor Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Flor; tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera, ella trabaja en la realización de bordados en estandartes, detentes, banderas, recordatorios y todo con hilos de bronce, dorados y plateados; La socia es una mujer muy dulce y emprendedora ella con su modesto trabajo y muy arduo por ser a mano, logra ahorrar para ayudar a sus padres y hermanos en la educación superior, ella desea estudiar diseño grafico. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para su negocio.

 La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Perlas” (The Pearls), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 24 years old and single. Flor earns her living by making embroidered banners, religious ornaments, pennants, souvenirs, and other items using bronze, gold, and silver thread. She is an extremely sweet woman who is enterprising with her modest business. As a result of her hard work making handmade products, Flor has been able to save so that she can help her parents and pay the college expenses of her siblings. She wants to study graphic design and is requesting a loan to buy materials for her business.

Flor appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucila   es viuda,  tiene un copetín y venta D. bebidas en el km 7_ Don Bosco, el trabajo D. la  misma es gratificante, ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad D. cliente, y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.

Con la ayuda D. su hija   están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso.
Es muy cumplidora con sus compromisos por lo que merece el debido apoyo para seguir creciendo.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra D. bebidas.
texts.en:
Lucila is widowed and has a liquor store and drink sales business at the 7th kilometer of Don Bosco. She finds her work fulfilling, now that she has plenty of customers and a satisfying income. With the help of her daughter, a strong will, dedication, and hard work, they are getting ahead. She is established as a successful small company, and is constantly moving forward. [Lucila] always fulfills her commitments and is deserving of the support she needs to continue to grow. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drink inventory

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Paulina; tiene 45 años de edad y es casada, ella tiene 2 hijos  trabaja vendiendo animales menores en el mercado de ttio, La socia vende pollos, patitos en su stand del mercado de Ttio; ella es comerciante minorista y solicita el préstamo para comprar mayor numero de aves de corral, La socia desea diversificar su negocio y traer otros animales para la venta.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Perlas” (The Pearls), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 45 years old, married, and has two children. Paulina is a small businesswoman who sells small animals, such as chickens and ducks, at the Ttio Market. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry. Paulina wants to diversify her business by bringing other types of animals to sell.

Paulina appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to sell

loans.name: Llegando Lejos 2 Group

texts.en:
Lude is the coordinator of her group Llegando lejos 2 (Going far). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their six children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to make her business grow. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her church activities and singing. 

Lude is excited to be taking her eleventh loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She started her business approximately six years ago with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying bags of charcoal and all kinds of vegetables. She also wants to buy clothes. She will use the profits to supply things her home may need. Her dreams are to generate a better income and give her children all they might need.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted a loan to invest in a business at her home. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Many clients have recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in a rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, vegetables, and clothes

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca nacida en San Matías Provincia de Santa Cruz de la Sierra soltera de 25 años de edad, vive en la Av. 2 de agosto,  la Sra. Blanca administra un taller de conversión a gas recibiendo un porcentaje de los trabajados realizados. Muchos de los vehículos están realizando esta inversión de la conversión de gasolina a gas, uno de los motivos es que es económico y reducen el gasto en gasolina y esto les permite tener mejores ingresos y otro es para reducir la contaminación en las ciudades,  el crédito que se le otorgo para el incremento de su capital de trabajo (compra de emulador, variador de avance, fierros, pernos y otros), "manifestó su satisfacción agradeciendo por la rapidez y la confianza depositada en ella".
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca was born in San Matías in the Province of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She is 25 years old and lives along August 2nd Avenue. Sra. Blanca manages a shop where she converts engines to run on natural gas and receives a percentage of the work being done in this market. Many vehicles are undergoing the conversion from gasoline to natural gas because it is more affordable and reduces fuel costs. In addition, it helps reduce pollution in the cities.

The loan being provided will be used to increase her operating capital for buying an emulator, timing devices, iron, bolts, and other supplies. Blanca says, “I am pleased with the quick response and the confidence that has been demonstrated to me.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an emulator, timing devices, iron, bolts, and other supplies for her gas conversion workshop

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Luisa; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquileres de sus tiendas, ella alquila para diferentes negocios, algunas de sus tiendas falta refaccionar y arreglar, por medio de este negocio, ella puede sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar sus tiendas apara alquilar. La socia solicita el préstamo para refaccionar el baño de la tienda y comprar materiales como cemento. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Qorimankacha”, which is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 53 years old, married, and has two children. Maria Luisa divides her time between her daily activities and her business renting storefronts to different businesses. Some of her properties are in need of repairs and remodeling. Thanks to her business, Maria Luisa is able to move her children forward. She wants to make improvements to her storefronts to make them available for rent, so she is requesting a loan to repair the bathroom in one of her stores and buy materials such as cement.

Maria Luisa is grateful to everyone who made this dream possible, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to repair the bathroom in one of her rental storefronts

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es: Aquilina, de 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en el poblado de Machente, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propio techo. Aquilina en su adolescencia, siempre deseaba tener su propio vehículo, con el pasar del tiempo pudo comprarse una camioneta, y esto es gracias a que supo aprovechar el terreno fértil que poseía, por lo que logró cultivar y comercializar café, lo suficiente como para generarle buenos ingresos económicos. Actualmente ofrece el servicio de transporte público, siendo su ruta por los caminos más transitados del valle donde vive. Siente muy contenta por haber cumplido uno de sus objetivos, de todas  maneras agradece a su pareja por el apoyo incondicional que siempre le ha brindado, ya que él es el encargado de conducir el vehículo, mientras que Aquilina se encarga de sus cafetales. En el futuro, piensa comprar un moto carro, con el propósito de que pueda vender helados y chupetes, por el cual piensa producir, de esa forma estaría marcando diferencia antes la demás competencia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas establecidas, además agradece a su banco comunal, por el buen clima cordial que prevalece en cada reunión mensual. Con el crédito que solicita piensa darle mantenimiento a su carro para evitarse problemas técnicos en el futuro, asimismo comprar abono para cuidar sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Aquilina is 43 years old, married, and has two school age children. She lives in her own home in the town of Machente, which is located in the tropical Peruvian jungle. Ever since she was a teenager, Aquilina has always wanted to have her own vehicle. As time passed she was eventually able to buy a truck. She also takes advantage of the fertile land that she possesses for growing and selling coffee, which is enough to generate a good income.

Aquilina currently offers public transportation services and has a route through the busiest roads in the valley where she lives. She is very happy to have accomplished one of her goals thanks to the unconditional support she always receives from her husband. He is also in charge of driving the vehicle while Aquilina takes care of her coffee crops. In the future, she wants to buy a motorcycle taxi so that she can sell ice cream and lollipops that she plans to make herself in order to differentiate herself from the competition.

This is her third loan with MFP. Aquilina promises to continue completing her payments on time. In addition, she is grateful to her Communal Bank because each monthly meeting is conducted in a friendly environment. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for vehicle maintenance in order to prevent technical problems in the future. In addition, she will buy compost to maintain her coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance & purchase compost for her coffee crop

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Manuel; el tiene 57 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio trabaja como docente en el colegio llamado Inca Garcilaso de la Vega, también se dedica a la venta de libros educativos que vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes colegios de la ciudad del Cusco, el socio quiere tener una librería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar libros al por mayor.  

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Manuel is a member of the Communal Bank “Qorimankacha”, which is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 57 years old, married, and has two children. Manuel is a teacher at the Inca Garcilasco de la Vega School and also sells educational books as an independent dealer to different schools in the city of Cusco. He also manages a bookstore, so he is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of books.

Manuel is grateful to everyone who made this dream possible, so he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase books

loans.name: Marina Luz

texts.en:
Marina is a 43-year-old single mother of three who lives in Santa Ana with her son (two of her three children are adults). Marina has been running a sewing business for the past three years. Marina makes bags, pants, children´s pyjamas, shirts for men and women as well as uniforms for gymnasts. She wakes up early every day so she can carry out the domestic tasks of cooking and cleaning before starting to sew. After she has taken care of household jobs, she starts to sew until her daughter arrives later on in the day. When her daughter arrives, Marina takes a break from sewing.

Marina has been hamstrung due to her inability to secure working capital. This loan will help to address this problem. Marina plans to use this loan to buy materials needed for sewing her products. Marina says her main goal is to increase her workload. She would like to seek out new clients and increase the number of orders she receives.

loans.use: For the purchase of materials necessary for sewing.

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es: Ercilia, de 64 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija, Milagros de 12 años. Juntos viven en el poblado de Machente, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propio techo a base de adobe. Ercilia se dedica a la actividad comercial, en donde tiene su propia tienda de abarrotes, lleva 26 años laborando en el mismo rubro y se siente muy contenta con lo que viene realizando, ya que le gusta estar en contacto con sus clientes, además le gusta atender con mucha amabilidad a sus clientes, quienes siempre va a su establecimiento a comprar algún producto que necesite. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero de vez en cuando recibe la ayuda de su pequeña hija. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio con la finalidad de implementar nuevos productos de vanguardia, de esa manera podrá captar mayor clientela, ya que espera generarse más ganancias para lograr construir su casa a base de material noble. Este es su decimocuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual, además confía en que llegará lejos con su banco comunal, ya que le ofrece muchos beneficios económicos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías de mucha demanda, con  el propósito de que atienda oportunamente a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ercilia, 64, is single and has a daughter, Milagros, who is 12. They live together in the town of Machente, located in the beautiful Peruvian rainforest, where she has her own home made of adobe. Ercilia is a merchant; she has her own grocery store. She has been in this line of work for 26 years, and she feels very content with what she has been doing. She enjoys having contact with her customers. In addition, she likes to provide friendly service to her customers, who always come to her store when there is a product they need to buy. She generally works on her own, but at times her small daughter helps her out. Her main wish is to expand her business with the objective of stocking her store with the newest products; in this way she will attract a bigger customer base. She wants to generate more income so that she can build her house out of solid materials. This is her 14th loan with MFP, and she pledges to continue to make her payments on time. In addition, she is confident that she will go far with her communal bank, since it offers her a lot of economic benefits. With the loan that she requests, she plans to purchase merchandise that is in high demand, in order to expediently serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to better stock her store

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group Cristo Redentor (Christ the Redeemer) 1 & 2. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to maintain quality service for her clients. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying being at her home resting.

Francisca has run a beauty salon business for over six years, starting with two blowers and curling irons that she bought with some savings. Francisca is excited to be taking out her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her venture by buying more beauty products, a blower and some hair brushes. She will save her profits because she wants to build her house. Living in her own house is her dream.

This associate began working with Esperanza because she needed to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry. The town’s main economic activity revolves around a free trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, a blower and hair brushes

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino, de 32 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos, tienen cuatro hijos. Juntos residen en el poblado de Machente, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de adobe. Faustino es una persona que toma decisiones con mucha cautela, ya que eso es la clave por el cual obtiene buenos resultados económicos. Recuerda que su primer negocio fue la actividad agrícola, en donde sigue produciendo y comercializando café, cuyos ahorros que hizo lo esta derivando para instalar una tienda de abarrotes, con el fin de que su esposa se haga cargo de dicho negocio. En un inicio la ventas fueron muy bajas, pero la constancia de salir adelante, pudo al final establecerse, hoy las ventas son considerables y su tienda de abarrotes está tomando mucha presencia en su poblado, debido a la cantidad de clientes que acuden a su establecimiento. Normalmente trabaja en su chacra por cuenta propia, pero cuando es temporada de cosecha, contrata peones para que le ayuden en la extracción del café, producto que es vendido en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar la producción de café en otras zonas estratégicas, con la finalidad de minimizar costo. Este es su decimocuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera oportuna, además  está satisfecho con su banco comunal, ya que todos son responsables y puntuales con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono para cuidar sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Faustino is 32 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the village of Machete, located in the box of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own home. Faustino is one who makes decisions with much consideration. This is why he gets good financial results. He recalls that his first business was an agricultural one. He continues to produce and sell coffee, and is using his earnings to set up a grocery store that his wife will run. At first the sales were low, but his desire to get ahead allowed his to become well established. Now grocery sales are very good and he is well known in his town because of the good service that he gives his customers. He usually works in the fields on his own, but hires field hands at harvest time and he sells his coffee in the distribution centers in his area. His future plans include increasing his coffee production in other nearby zones so that he can minimize his costs. This will be his 14th loan through MFP and be promises to make his payments on time. He is happy with his communal bank because its members are all responsible and punctual. He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his coffee plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Francia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) 3 & 4. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children in a safe environment. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy dancing.

Francia buys and sells new and used clothing. She has been in business for three years, starting with some money she received from previous employment. She is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her prior loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest further in her business. She will use the profits to increase her sales and to make her business grow. She also wants to save so she can study law, have a store and guide her children into professional lives.

This associate began working with Esperanza because she needed to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry. The town’s main economic activity revolves around a free trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy new and secondhand clothing

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Carmen; tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente, ella tiene 1 hijo,  trabaja elaborando bisutería, La socia realiza aretes, collares, pulseras, todo tipo de joyas en alambre con mostacillas y pines, la socia los vende los sábados en la feria de Túpac Amaru. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Carmen, 27, has a live-in partner and a son. She works making costume jewelry. She makes earrings, necklaces, bracelets and all kinds of jewelry made of wire, beads and pins. She sells her wares during the Saturday Túpac Amaru Market. She needs funds to buy materials. She is a member of the “LAS PERLAS” (Pearls) communal bank located in Huanchac, Cusco province, Cusco department. She makes us of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan and to commit to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to make costume jewelry.

loans.name: Kenet Francis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Kenet; tiene 27 años de edad y es soltero; El socio trabaja en la beneficencia pública, el también estudia en la universidad ingeniería de sistemas, El socio se auto educa, el requiere el préstamo para poder pagar una mensualidad en su universidad. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus estudios (pago de una mensualidad a la universidad).

 El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el pL. estipulado.
texts.en:
Kenet, 27, is single. He works for the Public Welfare department but also is studying Systems Engineering at the university. He is paying for his own education and needs the loan to pay his monthly tuition fees at the university. He needs the loan to invest in his schooling (to pay a monthly fee at the university). He is a member of the “LAS PERLAS” (Pearls) communal bank located in Huanchac, Cusco province, Cusco department. He makes us of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan and to commit to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for school.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente, de 68 años de edad, es viudo y tiene un hijo. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en el poblado de Machente, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. El buen clima que hay en el valle de Manchete, ha favorecido mucho para las plantaciones de café, siendo un producto que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Por tal motivo Vicente no se arrepiente de haber incursionado en esta actividad, y por tal percibe buenas ganancias, debido a la cantidad de compradores que tiene, asimismo puede cubrir los gastos de la familia. Generalmente trabaja en compañía de su hijo, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, para que le pueda facilitar en la recolección y selección de café, siendo al final vendidos en los centros de acopio de su poblado. En un futuro desea ampliar su producción de café, para ello comprará varias hectáreas, con el propósito de que pueda producir en grandes cantidades. Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además está contento con su banco comunal, debido a la transparencia de todos sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café, para ello comprará insumos y abonos.
texts.en:
Vicente is 68 years old; he is a widower and has one son. They live together in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle, where the village of Machete is located. He has his own wood framed house there. The good climate in the Machete valley is favorable to coffee plantations and coffee is in great demand in the market. Because of this, Vicente does not regret having started this activity, from which he obtains good earnings from the large number of buyers he has. In this way he is able to cover his family expenses. He generally works with his son, but during the harvest he hires field hands so that they can help with collection and selection of coffee, which is eventually sold in the distribution centers of his town. He wants to increase his coffee production in the future, and for that he wants to buy some hectares of land that will allow him to produce larger quantities. This will be his 13th loan through MFP and he is committed to make his payments on schedule. He is also happy with his communal bank, because of the transparency of all of its members. He will use the money from this loan to maintain his coffee plantations and buy supplies and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Nieves; tiene 35 años de edad y es madre soltera, ella tiene 3 hijos  trabaja atendiendo su tienda abarrotes y artesanía, La socia elabora diferentes trabajos manuales en sus ratos de óseo, ella mientras atiende la tienda de abarrotes, realiza bellos aretes en alambre y con mostacillas. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en sus materiales y en implementar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su tienda y compra de materiales para su artesanía. 
 
La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Nieves, 35, is a single mother of three children. She works tending to a grocery store and is a craftsperson. She makes a variety of handicrafts during her spare time while she tends to the store. She makes beautiful wire and bead earrings. She needs a loan to buy materials for her crafts and stock items for the grocery store. She is a member of the “LAS PERLAS” (Pearls) communal bank located in Huanchac, Cusco province, Cusco department. She makes use of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan and to pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store and supplies for her crafts.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. JUliana Isabel tiene 39 años, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales tres aun son menores de edad, ella se hace cargo de ellos completamente sola, es padre y madre  para ellos. Hace un año, forma parte del grupo "Mujeres Triunfadoras", formado por 8 personas, residentes del distrito de Comas.
Hace 17 años la Sra. Juliana Isabel inició su venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria, pero hace cuatro años ella ofrece sus caramelos en los omnibus de transporte público pero antes canta un par de canciones.
Los jueves y los domingos vende antiocuhos en la puerta de la casa de sus padres.
Gracias a su trabajo pudo comprar una carreta para poder iniciar su venta de anticuchos, además de mantener económicamente a sus hijos.
Uno de sus proyectos es poner una bodega, para lo cual se esfuerza mucho para poder juntar su capital.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá una partte en la compra de golosinas y otra parte en una operación a la vista que necesita de urgencia para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Juliana Isabel is 39 years old and has five children, three of whom are minors and she is their sole caregiver; she is both a mother and a father to them. A year ago she became part of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Winning Women) group, made up of eight people, all residents of the Comas district. 17 years ago Juliana Isabel started selling soft drinks on foot, but four years ago she began selling candy on public busses. Before beginning her sales, she sings a couple of songs. On Thursdays and Sundays she sells appetizers in front of her parents’ home. Thanks to her work, she was able to buy a cart from where she can make her sales and provide financial support to her children. One of her future projects is to open a store, and she puts forth lots of effort to save her money. She will invest part of the money from this loan in soft drinks and the rest she will use to pay for an eye operation, which she desperately needs in order to be able to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Juliana; tiene 52 años de edad y es conviviente, ella tiene 4 hijos  trabaja comprando y vendiendo ropa casa por casa o lleva a empresas y ofrece mercadería, la deja en dos partes, La socia ya conoce con quienes trabajar y cuando trae ropa de la ciudad de Lima, ella lleva a sus clientes a ofrecer. La socia necesita el dinero como capital de trabajo, ella comprara ropa al por mayor para ofrecer en Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the community bank "Las Perlas" (The Pearls), which is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. Bank member Juliana is 52 years old and lives with her partner. She has 4 children. She works buying and selling clothing house to house, or she takes it to businesses and offers them merchandise. She leaves it in two places. She already knows with whom to work, and when she brings clothing from the city of Lima, she offers it to her customers. She needs money for working capital. She will buy clothing at wholesale to offer it for sale in Cusco. She is applying for the loan to invest in her business. She is grateful for the loan offered through this means, and at the same time she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: Zenón, de 30 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos, Juan y Jhonatan de 3 y 1 año. Juntos residen en el poblado de Machente, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. Zenón, cuando abrió su restaurante, puso en práctica la buena sazón que tiene y que ahora sus clientes prueban en los platillos típicos que prepara, asimismo el buen servicio que ofrece le ha convertido en el favorito entre la gente de su poblado. Ahora la concurrencia de gente ha aumentado considerablemente, no obstante, es consciente de que la competencia es dura, es por ello que trata de mejorar continuamente en cuanto a sus potajes y acondicionar su local. Normalmente trabaja con su pareja y a la vez tiene una ayudante en donde lo pueda facilitar en la atención a su clientes. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su restaurante, con la necesidad de que albergue mayor capacidad de clientela y de esa forma tenga una estabilidad económica. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además está conforme por las buenas decisiones que toman en su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de carnes, verduras, frutas, aceite, ingredientes, de esa forma pueda elaborar sus deliciosos potajes, asimismo desea redecorar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Zenón, 30, lives with his life partner and their two children, Juan and Jhonatan who are 3 and 1 years of age. They live in the town of Machente located in the Peruvian highland jungle where they have their own wood house. When Zenón opened his restaurant he put into practice his good sense of taste and now his customers enjoy the delicious regional dishes he prepares as well as the fine service he offers making his restaurant a favorite among the residents of his town. Customer attendance has grown considerably yet he’s aware that competition is considerable. Therefore, he strives to always improve his dishes and better furnish his locale. He usually works with his partner and sometimes has a helper to assist with customer service. His plan for the future is to expand the restaurant in order to accommodate the larger number of customers in order to have improved economic stability. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he commits to repay his installments. Besides, he’s very satisfied with the good decisions his communal bank makes. He plans to use the requested funds to buy meats, vegetables, cooking oil and other ingredients to make his delicious stews as well as to redecorate the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat and other ingredients to make his dishes.

loans.name: Ruth Higidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Higidia; tiene 45 años de edad y es casada, ella tiene 3 hijos  trabaja como comerciante minorista ella compra y vende pollos, La socia  trabaja desde hace 15 años con este negocio ella es muy conocida y ya tiene su clientela frecuente. La socia toma los pedidos de sus clientes cada semana y se dirige a su mercado mayorista hace el pedido y le envían la cantidad que requiere. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de este un capital base de trabajo.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the community bank "Las Perlas" (The Pearls). This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. Bank member Higidia is 45 years old and is married. She has three children. She works in retail sales. She buys and sells chickens. She has worked in this business for 15 years. She is very well known and has regular customers. She takes the orders of her customers every week and goes to the wholesale market, where she places the order and sends her customers the quantity needed. She is applying for the loan to have a base of working capital. She appreciates the loans offered through this means, and at the same time she promises to make her loan payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell poultry

loans.name: Neria Group

texts.en:
This photo was taken at the business of Caroline M., a member of the Grupo Neria. It is located in the state of Veracruz in Mexico. In the photo you can see the group around her snack business. She works selling snacks and food and began doing so 17 years ago. She is requesting the loan to purchase food materials and a grill for the snacks. Her customers consider her to be a happy and hardworking person. When requesting the loan she felt happy because she is going to help her business grow. In addition, she will invest in cosmetics sales, which is another business of hers. She is 41 years old and completed up through the third year of elementary school. She lives in a common-law marriage and has a total of 4 children (3 females and 1 male). She wants this loan to possibly purchase a grill and to be able to prepare her snacks faster. She also hopes to remodel her house to move her business there, because her sister currently allows her to use the entrance to her house for her business and also helps her in preparing her snacks.

Maricela Martina V. is the president of the group. She is 38 years old and studied up to high school. She is a single mother and has only one daughter. She works raising and selling pigs, which she began doing 5 years ago. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of pigs to raise and sell, and for feed to fatten them.

The group is made up of 14 members. The others are: Olimpia S., shoe sales Obdulia G., mole sales María del Carmen L., chicken sales Mónica R., milk sales Concepción M., shoe sales Soledad M., handicraft sales Teresa M., chicken sales María Fátima V., shoe sales Emilia D., cosmetics sales Carolina V., shoe sales Luminosa S., cosmetics sales María Crispina M., food sales

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in their businesses (possibly to purchase a grill and pigs, respectively)

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "LAS PERLAS"; Este banco se ubica en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 56 años de edad y el es casado, el socio trabaja en transporte y alterna su trabajo con el servico de taxis, el socio ahorrando y trabajando en un auto alquilado logro poco a poco comprar su propia unidad de trasporte, ahora el socio esta solicitando el prestamo para aumentar y poder obtener una segunda unidad de taxi. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de una unidad de auto de segunda mano para que trabaje prestando servicio de taxi.

El socio agradece el prestamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the community bank "Las Perlas" (The Pearls). This bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. Jose is 56 years old and he is married. He works in transportation and alternates his work with taxi service. By working in a rented car and saving, he succeeded little by little in buying his own unit of transport. Now he is applying for the loan to expand and be able to obtain a second taxi unit. He is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of a secondhand car so that he can rent it out as a taxi. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make all his payments in a disciplined manner.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his capital to purchase a secondhand car

loans.name: María Roxana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora María tiene 31 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace ya 9 años,  fruto de aquella relación ha tenido tres hijos,  la última es una hermosa bebita de 10 meses la cual es la adoración de la casa. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de lotería.

Nuestra socia es  ama de casa, para ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de ropa y  venta de lotería. Vende ropa de todo tipo, su sistema de ventas es de puerta en puerta y también entrega en su casa, dice que deja a crédito y  hace sus cobros semanalmente, lo cual es una ventaja dice, porque al dejar a crédito incrementa más el precio y le queda más ganancias, además que al hacer sus cobros realiza nuevas ventas. Trabaja tres días a la semana unas cuatro horas ya que tiene que atender su hogar y  a sus hijos. Compra sus mercaderías en Guayaquil, ciudad a la que viaja una o dos veces al mes dependiendo de sus ventas.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar una parte en ropa y otra parte para comprar billetes de lotería. Es su primer ciclo en este Banco  aunque ya lleva varios años como socia de la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa que aun la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The communal bank 30 de Agosto meets in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. It is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint Paul festivals, and for its people's cheerfulness. María is 31 years old and has been in a relationship for 9 years. She has three children from that relationship. The youngest is a beautiful 10 month old baby girl who is the center of attention in the house. Her husband sells lottery tickets. Our member is a housewife. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she decided to start her own business selling clothing and lottery tickets. She sells all types of clothing door to door. She also delivers clothing to people's homes. She says that she sells the clothes on credit and collects every week. This is an advantage, she says, because selling on credit increases the price and she makes more profit. In addition, when she collects, she makes more sales. She works three days a week for about four hours, since she has to attend to her home and her chidlren. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil, where she travels once or twice a month, depending on her sales. She is going to use this loan in part for clothing and in part to buy lottery tickets. This is her first cycle in this bank, although she has been a member of Fundación Espoir for several years. Her dream is to finish her house, which is still under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and lottery tickets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Invest in her business (one wants to buy more video games for her business and the other to purchase cosmetics and perfumes to sell)

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es: Rosa Virginia es soltera, trabaja en el Hotel El Bosque como administradora desde hace 20 años, sus hijos son mayores y ya tienen su propia familia. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de realizar mejoras a su casa, como es reparacion de una pared y pintar la sala.  Expresa que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que AFODENIC le ha brindado, pues gracias a los creditos a podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Virginia is a single woman and she has been an administrator for the past 20 years in the El Bosque hotel. Her children are adults and they have families of their own. She requests a third loan with the goal of improving her home. She wishes to repair a wall and repaint the living room. She feels so grateful for the support Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) has imparted on her. It is thanks to these loans that she has managed to improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a wall and paint the living room.

loans.name: Erick Josue

texts.es: Erick de 33 años de edad es soltero, vive en union libre con la Sra. Anielka Rios con quien tiene una niña de 2 añitos de nombre Yaresly. Erick trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 5 años, desempeñandose como tecnico catastral. Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de reparar una pared de su cocina que se encuentra en mal estado y asi brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa con las mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Erick is 33 years old and he lives with his girlfriend, Miss Anielka Rios. Together they have a little girl, 2 years old, named Yaresly. Erick has worked in the municipal city hall in Juigalpa for the past 5 years. He is a survey technician. He requests a first time loan to repair a wall in his kitchen, to improve his family's quality of life. His dream it to have a home that is in a better state of repair for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a wall in his house.

loans.name: Darwin Jose

texts.es:
Darwin es soltero, vive en union libre con la Sra. Tadira Zamoran con quien tiene 2 niños: Jahaira de 10 años estudiando el 3er grado de primaria y Darwin de 9 años en 2do grado. Darwin trabaja parala Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza desde hace 6 años.

Esta solicitando  su 4to credito con el objetivo de realizar la dividision de los cuartos de su casa, pues actualmente no cuenta con ella y desea dividir los cuartos y la sala para que su familia cuente con mayor comodidad.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Darwin lives together with his girlfriend, Miss Tadira Zamoran. They have 2 children together. Jahaira is 10 years old and she is in grade 3 and Darwin is 9 years old and he is in grade 2. Darwin has worked in the municipal city hall for the past 6 years. He requests a fourth loan with the goal of adding a separating wall in one of the rooms in his house. He wishes to divide the room to provide the family with greater comfort. His greatest dream is to keep improving his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add a division in the bedrooms.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Rosa es la tesorera del Banco Comunal 30 De Agosto y la dueña de la casa donde se reúnen las socias, nos cuenta que ella junto con otras compañeras ya estaban en otro Banco Comunal pero que decidieron separarse y así formar este nuevo Banco en el cual es su primer ciclo.

Tiene tres hijos de una unión libre que mantiene hace 16 años, su marido es chofer particular.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de  todo tipo de ropa, su forma de venta es bajo pedido, tiene muchos clientes que le piden sus productos ya que les da facilidades de pago, ella cobra los fines de semana lo cual es una ventaja ya que al cobrar realiza nuevas ventas. Trabaja los fines de semana casi todo el día con la ayuda de su esposo. La mercadería va a comprar una vez al mes a Guayaquil ya que allá hay más variedad de productos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar un setenta por ciento  en comprar ropa de damas y el resto en prendas de hombres.

Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The community bank named "August 30" meets in the Picoaza district in the city of Portoviejo. The region is known for its commerce, its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for its happy population. Rosa is the treasurer of the community bank and it is in her house that the meetings occur. She, together with a few other colleagues, used to belong to a different community bank but they decided to break away to form their own. This will be their first loan cycle as a group. She has three children and she lives with her boyfriend. He is a taxi driver. She sells all kinds of clothing, selling her products on order. She has many clients and they order her products especially because she offers them flexible payment methods. She collects payments on the weekends, a great advantage to her because when she picks up a payment she always makes new sales. She works on the weekends with the help of her boyfriend. She purchases her merchandise once a month in the city of Guayaquil, location where she finds the best selection. Seventy percent of this loan will be used to purchase ladies' clothing and the rest will be used to purchase men's clothing. Her dream is to purchase a car to help her make her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ladies' and men's clothing.

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es:
Wilmer es casado con la Sra. Maritza Hernandez con quien tiene 3 niños: Ana Maria de 13 años estudiando el 1er año de secundaria, Luis Manuel de 10 años en 4to grado de primaria y el menor de 11 meses de edad de nombre Wilmer. Trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como policia municipal desde hace 6 meses. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un anexo en su casa y asi contar con mayor comodidad, pues su familia esta creciendo y desea que sus hijos tengan mas espacio y privacidad.  

Wilmer sueña con poder brindarle a su familia las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Wilmer is married with Mrs. Martiza Hernandez and they have 3 children together. Ana Maria is 13 years old and she is in grade 7, Luis Manuel is 10 years old and he is in grade 4, and the baby is 11 months old and his name is Wilmer. He has worked as a municipal security guard in the city hall of Juigalpa. He requests a first time loan with the goal of making an addition to their home, to improve the family's comfort. His family is growing and he wants his children to have more room and greater privacy. Wilmer dreams of providing his family with the best living conditions possible.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an addition to his house.

loans.name: The Stars Of Monte Blanco Group

texts.en:
This photo was taken in Concepcion M.'s house. She is a member of the community bank named "The Stars of Monte Blanco" and it is located in the state of Veracruz in Mexico. In the photo the group of women are standing around the Concha's merchandise. She has sold cosmetics for the past 4 years. She requests a loan to purchase her product in bulk to be able to sell at better prices. Her clients consider her to be a very responsible and hard working person. When she requested this loan she was very happy because she will be reinvesting in her business. She is 38 years old and she graduated high school. She is married and she has a daughter. She requests this loan to purchase merchandise in wholesale to increase her earnings and to make get better prices. She hopes to improve her financial standing and be able to have some home improvements made, to provide hr family with a better quality of life. Columba M. is the president of the group. She is 58 years old and she has a grade 6 education. She is a widow and she has a son. She has sold crafts for the past 2 years. She requests a loan to purchase more merchandise in Mexico city for resale. The group is made up of 11 members: Sofia M sells embroidered fabrics. Teresa M sells groceries. Laura P sells prepared foods. Maria Camelia G. sells coffee. Isabel H. sells plants. Sara R. sells snacks. Esperanza M. sells snacks. Liliana Guadalupe M. sells cosmetics. Balvina S sells chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto es casado con la Sra. Idealda Ortega con quien tiene 4 hijos: Nereyda de 22 años la cual es casada y tiene su propia familia, Luis de 18 años que va a entrar a la universidad, Jeffrin de 11 años estudiando el 4to grado de primaria y el menor Justin de un año y medio.  Don Luistrabaja parala Alcaldia de Juigalpa como policia municipal desde hace 6 meses. Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto anexo en su casa y asi brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.  Sueña con ir poco a poco mejorando su casa para que su familia pueda contar con las condiciones basicas de un hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is married with Mrs. Idealda Ortenga and together they have 4 children: Nereyda is 22 years old, is married and has her own family; Luis is 18 years old and he is about to start university; Jeffrin is 11 years old and he is in grade 4; and the baby is Justin, he is 18 months old. Luis has worked as a security guard in the municipal city hall of Juigalpa. He requests a first time loan to add a room to his house. He wishes to provide his family with a better quality of life. He dreams to keep improving their home so that their family will be able to enjoy the basic amenities in the home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an addition to his house.

loans.name: Dolores Cecilia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Dolores, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 20 años de la cual ha tenido tres hijos, todos menores de edad, dos de ellos están en la escuela. El marido se dedica a la venta de lotería en las calles de Portoviejo.

Ella al igual que su marido también se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, trabaja de lunes a viernes de cuatro a cinco horas diarias y los fines de semana junto con su marido se van a otros cantones cercanos para aprovechar las ferias que es cuando más se vende. Dice que esto si deja ganancias aunque  ya no quiere trabajar lejos de su casa por sus hijos, es por eso que desea poner una tienda en su casa.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir una tienda y así poder pasar más tiempo con sus hijos. Es socia de la Fundacion Espoir  y le ha gustado por la facilidad para obtener los créditos.
 
Sus deseos son tener un gran local comercial.
texts.en:
The community bank named August 30 meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The region is known for its commerce, their traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happy population. Dolores has lived with her boyfriend for the past 20 years and they have three children together. They are all minors and two are in school. Her boyfriend sells lottery tickets in the streets of Portoviejo. She, like her husband, sells lottery tickets, working from Monday to Friday for four or five hours a day. On weekends she and her husband go to fairs in neighboring villages because that is when the tickets sell the best. She says that the business is profitable but she doesn't want to work far from home anymore because of the children. She would like to set up a store in her home instead. This loan will be used to purchase basic grocery products to stock her new grocery store. She will be able to have more time with her kids this way. She is a member of the Espoir Foundation (Kiva Field Partner) and she has enjoyed being a member for the loans that are granted. Her dreams are to have a large grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es:
Walter es casado con la Sra. Yesenia Cerna con quien tiene un niño de 3 años de edad de nombre Walter, su esposa trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Don Walter trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como auxiliar de maquinaria pesada desde hace 10 años.

Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de embaldosar los cuartos y la sala y si el dinero lo permite comprar las puertas de su casa y posteriormente habitarla, ya que actualmente vive en casa de su papá.  

El mayor sueño de Walter es poder contar con una vivienda digna y comoda para su familia, ya que desea que su hijo crezca en un hogar propio construido con el esfuerzo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Walter is married with Mrs. Yesenia Cerna and together they have a little boy, 3 years old, named Walter. His wife works and contributes towards the household expenses. Walter has worked as a heavy machinery operator for the past 10 years for the city of Juigalpa. He requests a third loan to finish the walls of the bedrooms and the living room, and if there are enough funds he will also purchase doors for the house, to be able to move in afterwards. They currently live in his father's house. Walter's greatest dream is to have a dignified and comfortable house for his family. He wants his son to grow up in a house owned by them and built through his parents' efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish a room and purchase doors.

loans.name: Sol Radiante De Huaycan Group

texts.es: Gloria tiene 47 años y vive en la zona c de Huaycán, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales aun tiene a cargo a 2. Hace 4 años vendía solo ropa para niños, desde ya hace 2 años y medio que trabaja con Edaprospo y su trabajo de venta de ropa ah crecido y ya vende hasta Edredones para camas, chompas, sabanas y demás, últimamente se ah comprado una computadora y piensa invertir el ultimo préstamo en mas mercadería para su negocio, aunque le encantaría poner su propia tienda de venta de ropa importada, no obstante es también la presidenta ,desde sus inicios, del grupo “Sol Radiante de Huaycán” el cual ya lleva constituido 2 años y medio  y lo conforman 8 amigas y vecinas con ganas de prosperar.
texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and lives in Zone C of Huaycán. She is married and has three children, two of whom depend on her for support. Four years ago she began selling children’s clothing but since she began working with Edaprospo two and a half years ago, her clothing business has grown and now she also sells duvets, sweaters, sheets, and other things. She recently bought a computer and plans to invest her latest loan into more merchandise for her business, although she would love to start her own imported clothing store. She also happens to be the president of the “Sol Radiante de Huaycán” group, and has been since it was formed two and a half years ago. It is made up of eight friends and neighbors with a desire to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes.

Conocemos un poco de la señora Teresa, ella tiene 48 años y está casada hace 22 años, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales tres todavía son menores de edad, aunque seis de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo tiene un taller de cerrajería en el cual hace diversos trabajos.

Desde hace cinco años ella puso una  picantería (restaurant) en la cual prepara y vende encebolladlos y deliciosos ceviches de pescado y camarón. Trabaja de 7am a 13pm o hasta que se termine lo que se preparó. Trabaja los últimos cuatro días de la semana  ya que según ella es cuando mas ventas tiene. Sus hijos le ayudan tanto en la preparación como también en la atención a los clientes, dice que en días buenos vende hasta cien dólares, tiene muchos clientes debido al buen humor con que ella los atiende.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar  mesas y sillas además de productos para la elaboración de sus platos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya seis ciclos y le gustan las reuniones informativas.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital city of the province of Manabi, is surrounded by marvelous beaches of warm and pleasant climate. There, the community bank named Small Businesses is located. Getting to know Teresa, we know that she is 48 years old and she has been married for 22 years. She has 7 children, three of whom are still dependent, though six are still living at home. Her husband has a blacksmith shop where he carries out various projects. For the past five years she has had a restaurant where she prepares and sells traditional albacore soup and ceviche, a traditional uncooked, spiced dish of fish and shrimp. She works from 7am until 1pm or until she sells out of her foods. She works the from Thursday to Sunday because these are the days that see the best sales. Her children help her a great deal in preparing the foods and they are also involved in the customer service aspect of the business. She says that on good days she can sell up to a hundred dollars. She has many clients because she always attends to them in good humor. This loan will be used to purchase tables and chairs and ingredients to prepare her foods. She has been a member of the community bank for 6 loan cycles and she enjoys the informative group meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs and ingredients.

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes.

La señora Cruz María tiene 54 años, esta casada hace  38 años y todavía lo recuerda con mucha emoción,  de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos que según ella son la razón de su vida , aunque tuvo un gran dolor ya que uno de sus hijos falleció. Ella trabaja en un jardín de infantes de la localidad ya que le encantan los niños.

Desde hace poco tiempo con uno de los créditos otorgados por la Fundación Espoir comenzó con un negocio de venta de ropa por catálogos y productos de Esica (productos de cosméticos y perfumería). Negocio al cual dedica unas tres a cuatro horas al día, dice que aprovecha  vendiéndoles  a sus compañeras de trabajo,  estos productos los entrega  bajo pedido.
   
Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear e comprar una parte en ropa y otra en los productos de Esica ya que quiere incrementar sus ventas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya cuatro ciclos y espera continuar durante muchos mas.
 
Sus metas son comprar un carro y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital city of the province of Manabi, is surrounded by marvelous beaches of warm and pleasant climate. There, the community bank named Small Businesses is located. Cruz Maria is 54 years old and she has been married for 38 years. She holds thoughts of her marriage in her heart with tenderness. It is from this relationship that her four children were born, and they are her reason for living, although she suffered a devastation when one of them passed away. She works in a daycare in the community and she enjoys her work, for the love of children. From a past loan granted to her by the Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) she started selling clothing on order and cosmetics and perfumes of the Esica brand name. She works at her business three or four hours a day, though she takes the opportunity to sell to her colleagues as well. There products are ordered. This new loan will be invested in part to purchase clothing and in part to purchase Esica brand products to increase her sales. She has been a member of the community bank for four loan cycles and she hopes to continue on with them. Her goal is to purchase a car and carry out some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus M. is a married woman with two children who are four and eight years old. Her husband, Melisio, 31 years old, works as a fisherman to earn a living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They live in Purok Tuway in Barangay Canmoros, located within Binalbagan municipality in Negros Occidental province, Visayas islands. Venus operates two business ventures, a general store and a fishing business.

Venus joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past thirteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Venus has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.

For this, her 14th loan cycle, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP which she intends to use to purchase more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and home repairs. Venus M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito M. is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: General Store, Frozen Foods and Avon businesses.  She lives in Hda. Makina, Brgy. Relis, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF- Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her General Store, Frozen Foods and Avon businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Charito is now borrowing PHP 14,500 as additional working capital for her businesses.  This will be her 7th loan from NWTF- Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Charito aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for General Store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca G. is a married woman who lives in Bato, Samboan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business venture to buy and sell scrap gold. Her husband Falconiere G., who is 54 years old, works as a welder to earn his living. They have 2 children who are 31 and 34 years old. Rebecca joined NWTF- Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF- Project Dungganon, Rebecca has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for the business so that she can continue to save up for the future and to support the maintenance of the family.  Rebecca G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. Her photo was taken during the end of her weekly center meeting because her scrap gold was already sold.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: Additional working capital for scrap gold business

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes.

Aquí conversamos con la señora María que nos cuenta algo de su vida. Tiene 44 años, se caso hace un año pero ya vivia en unión libre con su esposo hace 26 años,  fruto de esta relación tuvieron 7 hijos de los cuales 5 ya son mayores de edad, los menores todavía estudian en el colegio. El esposo  se dedica al comercio informal.

Tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el cual además de comida también vende batidos de frutas y otros productos elaborados. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, desde las 2 pm hasta las 8 pm o hasta que se termine lo que se preparo. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos menores los cuales después de hacer sus tareas le ayudan en lo necesario para dar una buena atención a los clientes.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar dos licuadoras, vasos y productos para la preparación de la comida.
Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tiempo y esta muy contenta.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante en el centro y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital city of the province of Manabi, is surrounded by marvelous beaches of warm and pleasant climate. There, the community bank named Small Businesses is located. There we spoke with Maria and she told us a little about her life. She is 44 years old and she was married last year, though she lived with the same person for 26 years. Together they had 7 children, five of whom are now independent. The youngest children are in school. Her husband is a small business owner. She has a small restaurant in a section of her home from where she sells her dishes and fruit shakes and other food products. She works every day in the afternoons, from 2pm to 8pm or until the food sells out. Her youngest children help her after they have completed their homework. They are involved in the customer service aspect of the business. This loan will be used to purchase two blenders, drinking cups, and ingredients to prepare the foods. She has been a member of this community bank for some time and she feels very happy there. Her dreams are to have a restaurant in the city's downtown and to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two blenders, drinking cups and ingredients.

Her husband Benito D., Jr., who is 46 years old, works as a furniture maker to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 6 children who are 12 to 24 years old. Rosela joined NWTF- Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF- Project Dungganon, Rosela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional materials so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for the family. Rosela D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia T. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Orchids St., Brgy. Gairan, Bogo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF- Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000. Amalia is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more fish to sell.  This will be her 2nd loan from NWTF- Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 4,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Amalia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.name: Wiston Didi

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes.

En este Banco encontramos al señor winston, y nos cuenta algo de su vida. Mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 20 años y tiene tres hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar y también vende artículos de belleza.

El se considera un luchador, ya que el negocio al que él se dedica es duro pero se busca la forma de ganarse la vida. El es un vendedor ambulante, vende artículos para el hogar (planchas, ventiladores, licuadoras, tostadoras, entre otros artículos). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 8pm. Dice que es cansado pero que tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. La mercadería la compra en Portoviejo donde le dan precio para comerciante.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar toda clase de artículos para el hogar mas que todo planchas y licuadoras que es lo que mas se vende. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios ciclos y está muy agradecido porque lo han sacado de muchos apuros.
 
Su sueño es tener un local comercial para vender en un lugar fijo.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital city of the province of Manabi, is surrounded by marvelous beaches of warm and pleasant climate. There, the community bank named Small Businesses is located. Winston is a member of this community bank and he tells us about his life. He has lived with his girlfriend for the past 20 years and they have three children together. His girlfriend is a housewife and she sells cosmetics. He sees himself as a fighter. The business he has is difficult but he always looks to advance in life. He sells household items in the streets (irons, fans, blenders, toasters, etc.). He works every day from 8am to 8pm. He says that he feels tired but he knows he has to keep going for the sake of his family. He purchases his merchandise in Portoviejo, where he gets special deals. This loan will be used to purchase all kinds of articles for the home, but especially irons and blenders, articles that are most sought out. He has been a member of the community bank for many loan cycles and he is very grateful for the support as they have helped him significantly. His dream is to have a store from where to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase irons, blenders, toasters etc..
