loans.name: Yolita Jenny

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes.

La señora Yolita lleva ya tres años en el Banco Comunal y dice que siempre la ayudado mucho los créditos. Con profunda tristeza nos cuenta que es viuda ya que su esposo murió hace cuatro años pero todavía no puede superar su perdida, ya que era lo único que tenia, no tuvo hijos y vive con dos hermanos que son su compañía.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo, a la cual se dedica en cuerpo y alma ya que es su distracción y su forma de ganarse el sustento diario. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 8pm. Dice que si vende bastante ya que es la única tienda en el sector donde ella vive, le preocupa la inseguridad ya que como dice cada vez hay mas delincuencia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda con mayor variedad de productos de primera necesidad.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día mas.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital city of the province of Manabi, is surrounded by marvelous beaches of warm and pleasant climate. There, the community bank named Small Businesses is located. Yolita has been a member of the community bank for three years and she says that she has been helped significantly by the loans she has received. With great sadness she tells us that she is a widow, her husband passed away four years ago but she still can't get over the tremendous loss. He was all that she had. They did not have children and she lives with her two brothers, her only company. She has a small store from where she sells grocery items. She puts her heart and soul into the business. It is a distraction for her grief and it is a way to support herself. She works every day from 6 in the morning until 8 at night. Her sales are good because hers is the only store in the region where she lives. She is worried about civil unrest, seeing more and more acts of delinquency. With this loan she will stock her store with more variety of products. Her goal is to keep her business successful and to make it grow more and more every day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, cooking oil, sugar, meats, eggs etc..

loans.name: Leonor Concepción

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes.

La señora Leonor es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal,  le gusta por la facilidad para realizar los créditos y los pagos. Está casada hace 13 años y tiene tres hijos que se encuentran una en el colegio y dos en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante de legumbres en el mercado.

Vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de vender es puerta a puerta o por pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, trabaja sola de lunes a viernes unas cuatro horas al día. Su mercadería  la adquiere en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja una o dos veces al mes de acuerdo a las ventas que haga o los pedidos que tenga. Entrega a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lo cual en cierta parte le conviene ya que a crédito gana más y cuando realiza sus cobros realiza nuevas ventas.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mercadería de todo tipo ya que al momento tiene todo entregado y tiene algunos pedidos.

Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital city of the province of Manabi, is surrounded by marvelous beaches of warm and pleasant climate. There, the community bank named Small Businesses is located. Leonor is a founding member of the community bank. She enjoys the loans and the payments schedules. She has been married for 13 years and she has 3 children and all are attending school. Her husband sells vegetables in the market. She sells all types of clothing, selling door to door or through orders placed by clients. She works alone, from Mondays to Fridays about four hours a day. She acquires her merchandise in the city of Guayaquil where she travels once or twice per month depending on her sales and on the orders she receives. She completes her sales on credit, collecting payments weekly. She finds this arrangement convenient because she earns more, given that when she's there to collect payments she also makes new sales. This loan will be use to purchase more merchandise of all kinds. She has sold out of her merchandise and she has a few orders. Her dream is to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing of all types.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta V. is from the village of Research Minante, Cauyan City. She is 38 years old. Violeta is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and resale. Violeta is just starting this business.

In 2007, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Bulgan

texts.en:
Bulgan J. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and four year old son in Hovd province of western Mongolia. She and her family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son attends a local kindergarten and her husband works as a teacher in a local school. She has been operating a shoes trading business in the local trade center since 2009. She started her business by selling boots with white soles. Since then her business has expanded and she increased her product line. She provides a variety of shoes to satisfy her customer's needs. She is a very careful and hardworking person who says "It is difficult to get a job in my profession and so I decided to start my own business. In the future, I plan to establish a big shoestore." 

Bulgan is requesting a 3,825,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more shoes, at wholesale prices, from the neighboring province, Uvs, and to build a yard around their ger.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
La Señora Rosana M. es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza colonial, por los cuatro ríos que la bañan, su gastronomía y por ser la cuna de varios atletas que con el esfuerzo han brindados logros al país.

Doña Rosana  tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 22, 19 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive de manera independiente y su segundo hijo está estudiando en la universidad, su esposo trabaja como bodeguero en un reconocido centro comercial de la ciudad, la casa en la que habita no es de su propiedad por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Rosana se dedica a pintar cerámicas, oficio que lo aprendió cuando trabajaba en una fábrica, en la actualidad trabaja independientemente,  se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, en este negocio lleva  2 años, vende recorriendo por diferentes lugares.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito con la banca comunal. El nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa, zapatos y así ir creciendo un poco mas en su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Rosana M. is a member of the community bank named "El Mirador". She lives in the city of Cuenca. It is a city known for its colonial beauty, for the four rivers that flow across the city, and for its traditional foods. It is also the birthplace of many athletes that have brought acclaim to the country. Rosana is 39 years old, she is married, and she has 2 children aged 22 and 19 years old. Her eldest son is married and is independent but her youngest son is in university. Her husband is a stockperson at a well known store in the city. The house they live in is a rental property. Rosana paints ceramic items, a trade she learned when she worked in a factory. She works independently and she also sells clothing and shoes. She has had this business for 2 years. She sells by traveling to various locales. This is her second loan with the community bank. This new loan from Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) will be used to invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes, to make her business grow. Her goal is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario D. is from the village of Soyung Echague. He is 45 years old. Mario is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mario makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals, selling rice and frozen foods. Mario has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Mario is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mario from ASKI. loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah. This time she will invest the loan amount in her husband’s business selling stamp papers, which are used for legal documentation. She is 42 years old and a very supportive person. Tahira lives in the small town of Khanewal, which is located in Multan, Pakistan. She supports her family financially by working as a teacher in a nearby school. In her spare time she also has a business selling clothes. She visits the city of Multan on weekends to purchase clothes, which she sells to customers in her neighborhood. 
 
Tahira has four sons and two daughters. By being a teacher, she knows the importance of education. She has enrolled all of her children in school, except her oldest one who didn’t show an interest in education. After he passed the 10th standard, he left school and now works in a private firm for a meager income.
 
With the loan amount, Tahira's husband will buy stamp papers in large quantities to sell to his customers. She is hopeful that this loan will help her husband improve his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah. In previous loan years she has proven herself to be a responsible client who paid her installments on time and attended every meeting.
 
Note: In the picture, the lady who has raised her hand is Tahira.

loans.use: To buy stamp papers used for legal documentation

loans.name: Paola Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señorita Paola B. es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por la parroquia Turi la misma que se caracteriza por ser el balcón de la ciudad de Cuenca, de donde se admira gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica  a la cría de animales y a la agricultura la misma que en la mayor parte es solo para el consumo.

La Señorita Paola tiene 21 años, es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres la misma que es propia, su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y su papá es chofer profesional.
 
Paola se dedica a atender el bar de un colegio en el cual labora medio día y el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a estudiar en la universidad.
 
Este es su primer crédito en la banca comunal y ha sido invitada por su tía a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres que luchan con el fin de mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. El  crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra productos para el bar.
 
Su meta es ser una profesional en el campo de la medicina.
texts.en:
Paola B. is a member of the community bank named "El Mirador". She lives in the region of Turi and it is known as Cuenca's lookout, as it is here from where you can see the expanse of the city. The population is made up of farmers and agriculturists, products that are mostly consumed within the city. Paola is 21 years old, she is single, and she lives with her parents' house. Her mother takes care of the household chores and her father works in public transportation. Paola is a cafeteria worker in the local school. She works half days and the rest of the time she takes courses in university. This is her first loan with the community bank where she was invited by her aunt to take part of the group. These women all struggle to find greater financial stability for their homes. The loan granted through Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) will be invested in products to be sold in her cafeteria. Her goal is to be a health care professional.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, juices, snacks, sweets etc.

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
La Señora Martha T. es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por la parroquia Turi la misma que se caracteriza por ser el balcón de la ciudad de Cuenca, de donde se admira gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica  a la cría de animales y a la agricultura la misma que en la mayor parte es solo para el consumo.

Doña Martha se encuentra en su noveno crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, ha llegando a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las compañeras que la conforman.
 
Trabaja en un almacén de muebles solo en la época de vacaciones y después se dedica a su hogar en donde también cría pollos a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
La Señora Martha tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 11, 10 años de edad, sus 2 primeros hijos estudian en el colegio, su ultima hija estudia en la escuela, su esposo es taxista, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad es de sus suegros y los gastos son compartidos.
  
El nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra uniformes para sus hijos.

Su mayor sueño es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Martha T. is a member of the community bank named "El Mirador". She lives in the region of Turi and it is known as Cuenca's lookout, as it is here from where you can see the expanse of the city. The population is made up of farmers and agriculturists, products that are mostly consumed within the city. This is Martha's ninth loan through her community bank. She has developed a close friendship with the other members of the group. She works in a department store but only during the summer months. At other times she works from home, raising chickens that she later sells in her community. Martha is 31 years old, she is married and she has 3 children, aged 15, 11, and 10 years old. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a taxi driver. The home where they live is not theirs but rather it belongs to her parents-in-law. They share all the expenses. This new loan granted through Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) will be invested in the purchase of uniforms for her children. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase uniforms.

loans.name: Rubina Abdul Hamid's Group

texts.en:
Rubina lives in the small town of Khanewal in Pakistan near the city of Multan. She is 34 years old and married to A. H.. A. H. is illiterate and works as a daily wage laborer. Rubina sells bangles to support her family financially.  
Rubina is the mother of seven sons. Her eldest son is also illiterate and works as a laborer like his father. Rubina's other sons are enrolled in school and receiving an education, except the youngest one who is just three years of age. 
Working as a laborer is an uncertain job for A. H. because it is not permanent –  people hire laborers on a contract basis and that is why he sometimes has work and sometimes not. In light of the current financial situation, A. H. has decided to start a fruit-selling business and leave his work as a laborer. Therefore, Rubina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for this purpose. With the loan, A. H. will buy a fruit cart and some seasonal fruits for resale.  
Rubina hopes that this business will be a profitable one and that her family will be able to enjoy a better financial life. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She hopes that this experience will be a good one for her family.   
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Rubina.

loans.use: To buy a cart and seasonal fruits to start a fruit-selling business

loans.name: Zaib Muhammad Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Zaib lives in Khanewal, a small town located near the city of Multan, Pakistan. Khanewal is famous for its shrines. She lives in a two-roomed brick house with her family, and she moved here with her family 30 years ago. Zaib is 56 years old, married to M. R., and the mother of five children – three sons and two daughters. Her four children are receiving an education except her eldest son who completed his education until 10th standard and couldn't continue further studies due to financial constraints. He now works as a property dealer in a company.
Zaib's husband is a rickshaw driver. He has been in this business for the last five years and it enables him to manage his children's education expenses. His eldest son contributes financially to his family as well in order to keep things running smoothly. Zaib has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband because he has problems driving his rickshaw. With the loan, he will repair its engine and give it a new look by replacing the old seat covers with new ones. Zaib thinks that a fully repaired rickshaw will allow her husband to work with more efficiency.
Zaib is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her third loan cycle. In previous years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client who attended every meeting and paid her installments on time.
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Zaib.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw and replace the old seat covers

Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a resident of a small city called Riwind in Pakistan. Riwind city is famous for its dairy industry. She owns a 3-room brick house in the area of Haveli Ghatia Wali of Riwind and lives in it with her husband and a son. She is 50 years old and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife and takes care of her family. 

Her son’s name is Usman and he has completed his education through 10th standard. Then he started working with his father in a photo studio in a nearby market.  Her husband’s name is R. A.. Both her husband and son spend their time in a photo studio where they provide services to their customers by taking their photographs and framing them. They also sell used mobile phones from their photo studio. They have a good clientele base which enables them to cover the financial expenses of their family.  

Ayesha has applied for a loan from Asasah for her family business. With the loan amount they will buy digital cameras and used mobile phone sets to offer better quality services to their clients. She hopes that her husband and son will be able to improve their business with the help of this investment. 

Ayesha is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 4th loan cycle. In the previous loan years she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy digital cameras and used mobile phones

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus J. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 51 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling vegetables in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jesus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma resides in a small city called Riwind in Pakistan. Riwind city is famous for its dairy industry. She owns a three-room brick house in the area of Jalal pura, which is a small colony of Riwind, and lives in it with her family.  She is 39 years old, married to M. Y., and has 2 sons and a daughter. Her younger son reads in 6th standard and her daughter is in 2nd standard. 

Her elder son left his education after 8th standard and started doing work to financially support the family. He is a tailor by profession and sews gents' clothes specifically. Salma herself is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is particularly good at her ability for creating unique designs on the clothes. 

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who has a clothing selling business. He operates his clothing shop in the nearby market where he offers both ladies' and gents' clothing for sale to his clients. With the loan amount he will buy a variety of men’s and ladies' suits for his shop. She is confident that his business will be improved after making this investment into it and that her family will be able to live in a better financial condition. 

Salma is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 5th loan cycle. In previous loan years she has proved herself a responsible client who never missed any meetings and paid her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes of ladies and gents for reselling

loans.name: Marites

Marites M. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Mrs. K., 37, is married with three young children. All of her children are no longer in school and have had different jobs. K. and her husband earn a living by cultivating crops on their own farmland. In addition to their farm work, K. also buys hair to resell to people who use it to decorate/highlight their hair. K. is requesting a loan to add to her personal savings to be able afford to buy a secondhand vehicle in order to make family transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand vehicle in order to make family transportation easier.

loans.name: Chanthavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthavy T., pictured here with her husband, Mr. Vichet Meas, lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1992 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. 

Mrs. Chanthavy Teo and her husband are farmers of jasmine flowers. They also buy some jasmine flowers from their fellow villagers for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. 

Chanthavy has asked for a Kiva loan one time previously. She is now requesting another loan of $300 to pay school fees for her children. She hopes they all will have a good job when they finish their studies.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-at N., who is 37 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Dea, who is 30 years old (and pictured here), live along the National Road Number one, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two children, one son and one daughter. One of them attends school and the other stays at home. 

Sam-at has been driving a Tuk Tuk taxi (a motorized rickshaw) in Phnom Penh for a year. His wife stays at home and does housework. The house where they live is small, so it’s difficult for family members to stay. Therefore, Sam-at is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to add to his own money to renovate the house.

loans.use: To add to his own money to renovate the house where he lives.

loans.name: Loun

texts.en:
Loun S. is a local farmer who raises pigs and rice to earn a living. She is 34 years of age and is a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she lives with other family members. Loun S. has a life partner in her husband who is a professional teacher in the public secondary school. The couple has given birth to two kids, both of whom are enrolled in school.

In view of the coming farming season, Loun S. wants to buy a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service for other farmers. As she lacks money to buy one, Loun S. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. She will use these funds to buy a machine to begin providing her service.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel L. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorcycle transportation to local community members. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ruel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide his service

loans.name: Sreykea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreykea C. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Bunheng Phai, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for over thirteen years and have six children, five sons and one daughter. Four of them attend school and the other two are still too young. 

Sreykea runs a grocery store at her home. Her husband has been a fisherman for more than ten years. She is asking for a loan of $900 to purchase a motorcycle for her brother to drive to work. Also, she will use part of the loan to buy grocery items for resale in her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store and a motorcycle for her brother.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mr. Kong S., 63, and his wife, Mrs. Sarum Chea, 59, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1975 and have six children: five sons and one daughter. All of them are married and live outside the family home.

Kong has been a carpenter for six years and his wife has been selling finished silk fabric for two years. Kong is requesting his first loan of $500 to repair a machine he uses in his carpentry business and help provide capital for his wife to buy finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To repair a machine used in his carpentry business and to provide capital for his wife to buy finished silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en: Nowadays, at the time of global crisis, almost every country is in an unstable position. Even highly-developed, industrial, economically self-sufficient states are confronted by difficulties. It’s the same with the developing country, Kyrgyzstan. But it’s not a forcible argument to stop working, stop earning money and suffer losses. People want to live happily against all the odds. Damira K. is the leader of this group. She is 33. Together with her husband, who earns his livelihood by working as a private builder, she brings up four sons, all in school. Besides working in the sphere of passport documentation, Damira runs a family business. Thirteen years ago, having some money saved, she and her husband began their business. The very first step was starting to breed cattle; the second was to increase the number of cattle. With money received from the loan Damira wants to purchase more cattle. In the future, she wants to widen the shed to enable her to keep more cattle and, in order to improve the family’s housing conditions, make thorough house repairs. Damira's partners are: Aigul D., 29, a private entrepreneur, is married and has three children. She opened a shop after getting some money from her husband. Her aim is to extend her business. She wants to expand the assortment of goods and to make major shop repairs. Zarema K., 32, is married to a builder and has no children. She and her husband earn their living by selling goods in the market. After earning a profit, they bought a refrigerator and a washing machine. The aim of the loan is to expand her assortment of goods. In future she hopes to rent a container. Kauhar M., 30, is the treasurer of the group. She is married and has five children. She began her business with selling ice-cream. As the business developed, she also began to sell disks and audio cassettes. Her aim is to extend her business. She intents to finish a new house she is building. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Naseem Naveed Ahmad's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small, two-roomed house there where she lives with her family. A happy-natured lady, Naseem is 40 years old and stays at home. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and takes care of her family. Naseem is well known among her neighbors for her hospitality. She welcomes her neighbors and relatives with a big smile on her face.
Naseem's husband is N. A. and he is a hairdresser by profession. He runs a barber shop in the nearby market. His shop is a popular one in the area due to his art of hairdressing. Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan, he will buy hair products such as hair gels, colors and creams.
Naseem thinks that her husband has an ability to make full use of the money to improve his business. She is confident that the result will be increased profit for her family.
Note: In the picture, the lady who holds a book (an Asasah passbook) in her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy hair products for barber shop

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby P. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 22 years old and married. To make a living, Bobby owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from fishing and selling seafood products, including different varieties of ocean fish, in the local community. Bobby has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Bobby joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally O. is from the town of Banga. She is 45 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for breeding. Sally also cooks food that she sells in her neighborhood.
Sally joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sally is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo L. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 47 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Cirilo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing motorela, or habal-habal, services to local community members (a motorela is a motorcycle with an extended seat). Cirilo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 9,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Cirilo joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cirilo is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Taj Muhammad Ramazan's Group

texts.en:
Taj lives in the small Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She is married to M. R. who has a construction supplies selling business. He operates a shop in the main market. Borewala is a small city and there is not much competition in this area of business.
Taj has proved herself as a great mother and very supportive wife. She does sewing work in order to support her husband financially. She receives orders from boutiques and makes beautiful clothes for them for a profit. She also does hand embroidery. Taj's husband wants to improve his business by adding more construction supplies to his shop because sometimes he is unable to meet a customer's requirements due to stock shortage. He wants to avoid this situation in the future. Therefore, Taj has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially assist her husband in his business. With the loan, he will buy supplies such as cement, sand and bricks for his shop. Taj is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business with the help of the loan.
Note: In the picture, the lady who holds the book (an Asasah passbook) in her hand is Taj.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl T. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old, widowed and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Cheryl owns and operates a specialized retail business buying and selling coconut shells, or copras, in the local community. Cheryl has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Cheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconut shells to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

texts.en:
Elvira C. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.

loans.name: Sahadathon Uldashova's Group

texts.en:
Sahadathon U. is the leader of this group. She is 45, married, and has raised two sons and a daughter. Her first son works as a welder, the second is at school, and her daughter helps with the housework. Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS Sahadathon started to grow tobacco, rice and cotton. Selling a part of the harvest on the market she makes 1,900 KGS per month. Her husband now works in Russia. Sahadathon has saved money to purchase a used vehicle. She wants to buy it in order to lower her business transport costs. However, she also needs 20,000 KGS to realize her plans, which is why she is requesting a loan. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for her son.
Nafisahon U., 21, is the treasurer of the group. Nafisahon and her mother cultivate cotton and sell it on the market. In this way, they make 5,000 KGS per month. Nafisahon has applied for a loan because she needs money to purchase building materials in order to finish repairing her house.
Mansurbek G., 25, is married and has a newborn son. His wife stays at home to take care of their child. With an initial investment of 8,000 KGS, Mansurbek started cultivating cotton and maize. Because of the low prices for the harvest, he doesn’t have enough money to finish repairing his house. With his loan, he wants to purchase building materials. Mohirahon S., 31, is married. She has two daughters and two sons. Her first son and first daughter are at school and the others are not yet old enough. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Mohirahon started to breed cattle. Selling some cattle after fattening she makes 1,500 KGS per month. With her loan, she wants to purchase cattle for breeding and repair her house.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
