loans.name: Hazel Grace

texts.en: Hazel Grace G. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 21 years old and is single. Hazel Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling firewood in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Hazel Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more firewood to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Hazel Grace plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry M. is a 26-year-old single man. He is a motorcycle transport operator and has been in operation for two years. Most of his income is utilized in paying school fees for his siblings.

Henry is borrowing his second loan from KADET with which he plans to service his motorcycle, expand his business, and open a retail shop in Magongo.

Henry hopes to buy a tuk tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) for his transportation business in the future.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and open a retail shop

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives with her family in a two-room brick house in a city called Borewala, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its shrines. She is a seamstress and sews clothes by taking orders from her nearby areas. She has been doing this for many years and people know her in the region for her quality work.

Nasreen is married to F. E., who has a business selling spare parts. He operates a small shop in the nearby market where he sells spare parts for different vehicles to earn an income for his family. He has been doing this business for over seven years. He sells spare parts of every quality and of every price so every kind of customer can approach him easily to buy them.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy spare parts in large quantity which enable him to increase his clientele and generate a good profit. She hopes that this investment will prove beneficial for her husband’s business and result in her family being able to have better facilities in life.

In the photo, Nasreen is the lady who holds a book (it’s her Asasah passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy spare parts in large quantity for his business

loans.name: Joey

texts.en: Joey M. is from the village of Villaverde, Iligan City. She is 32 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Joey owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal products such as lotion, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Joey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Joey plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mahpuza's Group

texts.en: Mahpuza S. is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married and has raised a son and two daughters. The first daughter helps her mom with her business, and the other children are at school. A year ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms Mahpuza started to take orders and prepare cakes and cookies. In this way she earns 5,000 soms per month. Her husband works as a driver and his monthly salary is 5,000 soms. Mahpuza applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase an oven for baking cakes. In the future she wants to expand her business and open a big store. The other members are: Dilabzahon H. is the treasurer of the group. She is 37 and married with a son and two daughters, all of them in school. Her husband is a private entrepreneur: several years ago he saved money and purchased welding equipment to provide welding services. He also resells metal. In this way he makes 5,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Dilabzahon and her husband want to purchase more materials needed to provide welding services. In the future she plans to start repairing her house. Nargizahon M., 28, is married with a son and two daughters. Her daughters are at school but her son is not yet old enough. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, Nargizahon rented a place and started to sell convenience goods and cosmetics. But then, because of family reasons, she stopped her business. Now, she has started to breed livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a sheep to increase the number of her livestock. The rest of the money she will use to restart her previous business activity. Mohirahon S., 59, is married with a son who is 31 and works as a welder. Mohirahon and her husband are farmers. They breed livestock and cultivate different fruits and vegetables. With money received from the loan Mohirahon wants to purchase sheep for breeding and mineral fertilizer for her farm. In the future she plans to start repairing her house. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase an oven for baking cakes

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle L. is from the village of Villaverde, Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Roselle is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Roselle operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling school supplies in the local community. Roselle has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Roselle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselle is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roselle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley M. is a 35-year-old married father of five children. He is the sole provider in the family and operates a bakery at his home in Jomvu. He has been in business for the last 10 years, and his business is a success.

This marks Stanley's first loan from KADET LTD., and with the money he plans to purchase ingredients for baking, e.g., flour, margarine, and sugar. He hopes to use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to be successful through KADET loans.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for baking, e.g., flour, margarine, and sugar

loans.name: Rashidan's Group

texts.en:
Rashidan is a seamstress but at work she never forgets her family's needs. She starts sewing clothes after she finishes the household chores and cooking their meal. Her family loves her a lot and respects her caring nature. She makes beautiful looking clothes of the latest designs and sells them to different boutiques and ready-made garment shops in the market. Rashidan is a resident of the city called Borewala which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. Borewala is famous for its shrines. 

Rashidan is married to S. A., who sells construction supplies. He has a shop in the main market which faces a heavy crowd of people. The advantage of having a shop in the busy market is that people can easily approach the shopkeepers to buy items according to their need. 

Rashidan has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband expand his business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and bricks. Rashidan is confident that her husband will be able to increase his income by investing money in his business. 

Note:  In the picture, the lady who holds a book (an Asasah passbook) in her hands is Rashidan.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov N. is a 44-year-old widow and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Nov N. has four children. Three of her children are employed and provide their income to help the family, and the other one is going to school. Nov N.’s employed children travel to work by taxi several days. She hopes to cut down the cost of hiring taxis through using a loan she has requested to buy a secondhand modern motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand modern motorcycle.

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela T. is from the village of Villa Verde, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Michaela is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Michaela owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Michaela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Michaela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michaela is requesting a  loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Michaela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth L. is from the town of Banga. She is 51 years old. Elizabeth is married. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. She also plants corn and sells her harvest to the market. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years.

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other inputs

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Mr. Ty E. (pictured), 27, is a soldier. His wife, Mrs. Chanthean Keo, 36, runs grocery store at home. They have been married since 2003 and have three children-one son and two daughters. The family lives in a village along national road number four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 


Ty is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase more grocery items for his wife’s store.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for his wife’s store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine O. is a 36 year old single mother of two children ages ten and six. She is in the business of charcoal selling in Mikindani, Mombasa, Kenya. For the last  year the business has been doing well and Catherine plans to boost the stock of charcoal with this, her second loan. Catherine hopes to expand from selling charcoal only and also to sell cereals as a secondary business with the anticipated profit.  In future she hopes to buy a truck and use it for transporting charcoal and firewood into Mombasa.

loans.use: To purchase stock of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Shahnaz Bano's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz bano lives in a small city in Pakistan called Borewala.  
She is a house wife as well as a working woman who runs a sewing business. She operates her business from her home. She takes orders from nearby areas and completes the orders on time to earn profit. 
Her husband name is M. S. who has a business of selling fruits. He gets up early in the morning and puts the fruits on his cart and leaves his home for selling. He visits different streets in the community and sells fruits by announcing his products in a loud voice. Shahnaz also helps her husband by cleaning the fruits with water and arranging them on the cart. 
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy seasonal fruits in large quantity.  
She hopes that this investment will prove successful for her husband’s business and he will be able to increase his income. 
Note: “In the picture, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah passbook) in her hand is Shahnaz bano”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for fruit selling business

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mr. Sophy U. (in the photo with his wife), is 47 years and his wife, Mrs. Thet Yun, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1995 and have three children-two sons and one daughter. All the children are in school. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mrs Thet Yun sells dessert in the village. 

Sophy has been driving a motor taxi for a year. He wants to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk or auto rickshaw because it could carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Hence he is asking for a loan of $800 to buy a Tuk Tuk.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie P. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 43 years old. Elvie is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. is 45 years old, married, and the father of nine children. His children are between sixteen years and three years of age. Stephen sells charcoal and firewood in Mombasa. His business is 10 years old. It has been doing well. Stephen's wife Christina runs a green grocer that supplements the family income.
This is Stephen's first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase stock of charcoal for sale. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to boost his wife's grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorn S. (pictured above), and her husband, Mr. Broshun Nhoem, have been married since 1998 and have two young daughters. One of them attends school and the other one is still a baby. The family lives along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.


Mrs. Lorn S. and her husband sell fish, making their purchases from fisherman in the village and then transporting them to Prek Phnao market to sell. The couple does not their own shop within the market to sell their fish, and as a result, must spend a lot of money on rental fees which makes it very difficult to support their family. They want to buy their own space at the market, but they do not have enough money.   
 
Therefore, Lorn is asking for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To purchase a space for a shop to sell fish.

loans.name: Dhoren

texts.en:
Dhoren F., 25, is married and has a six-year-old child. She is from the town of Banga in the province of South Cotabato on the island of Mindanao. Dhoren makes puto (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. She hopes that her business will grow.

Dhoren joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. Dhoren successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase the ingredients needed to make puto to sell. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed to make puto (rice cakes)

loans.name: Mirriam Jeptonui

texts.en:
Mirriam Jeptonui C. is 33 years old, married and has five children aged sixteen, fourteen, eight, five and three years old. Her husband, William Kipsang, is employed and contributes to the family’s household needs, such as school fees and food. Mirriam sells cereals and dried legumes in the town of Eldoret. She has been in business for the past five years and makes 4000 KES per month.

Mirriam learned about KADET through a friend. This will be her third loan with KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock like bags of maize and beans. With the income from these sales, she plans to pay back the loan and grow her business. With her husband’s help, Mirriam plans for her children to have the best education possible.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and beans

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly D. is 44 years old and married. She is from the village of Tibanga outside of Iligan City on the island of Mindanao. Beverly owns a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Beverly has been in business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Beverly is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 46 years old. Josephine is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food and daily use products to sell

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-at O. and his wife, Mrs. Vuthy Khut, are 40 years old. They have been married since 1990, and have two sons, both of whom are in school. The couple lives along national road number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sam-at has been a motor taxi driver since he got married. His wife has been a scarf weaver since 2000. He is asking for his first loan of $700 to pay school fees for his sons.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his sons

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is a 42 year old married mother of seven children. She runs a retail shop in Jomvu that has been in operation for two years. It is doing well.

This loan marks Elizabeth's first borrowing from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase cereals, margarine, soaps and a variety of sweets. Her clients are the area residents, who enable her shop to reap a profit of Ksh. 15,000 a month.

She hopes to expand her business greatly in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, margarine, soaps and a variety of sweets

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta Q. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Henrietta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Henrietta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Henrietta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Henrietta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Henrietta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Henrietta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food and daily use products to sell

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a resident of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small house with two rooms in the area 303 EB and lives in it with her family.  

Her husband's name is M. H., and he runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. His shop is a popular one in the area due to his excellent products and quality services. 

Bashiran is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighbors/clients. She has been running this business for the last seven years and is very popular among her clients due to the quality of her work and the timely delivery of her finished goods. Both Bashiran and M. H. use their incomes for household expenses. They are also able to save money for rainy days.  

Bashiran has applied for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy groceries such as cooking oil, spices, lentils, and candies for his grocery shop. 

Bashiran is hopeful that this investment will be a good one for her husband’s business and that he will be able to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa C. is from the town of Trento. She is 63 years old and married with 3 grown children. To make a living, Teresa has a rice farm. Teresa works hard to help her husband provide for their family.  Teresa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other supplies for her rice farm. A more productive rice crop will generate additional revenue, helping to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor C. is from the town of Trento. He is 49 years old and married with 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Victor farms rice and has been doing so for over 12 years. Victor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victor has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Victor is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Rebecca Gannaban Group

texts.en:
Rebecca G., age 41, is from the village of Arcon and is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI.  In a group loan, each member receives an individual loan, but they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rebecca G..

Rebecca is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca has a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2300 PHP a month.  Rebecca recently joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar lives with her family in a two-room brick house in an area called 303 EB in Borewala, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. A very talented lady, Kousar operates a sewing business. She gets up early in the morning and finishes her household chores and starts sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She makes beautiful clothes and stitches with perfect measurement.  In seven years of working, she has never received any complaints from her customers.

Her family respects her a lot and takes care of her just as she does for them. In this way, she has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. With the loan he will buy groceries such as cooking oil, rice, soaps and lentils to sell in his shop.

Kousar is confident that by investing loan in her husband’s business, his business condition will be improved and her family will enjoy a better life.

loans.use: To stock her husband's grocery shop.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en: Melissa L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 36 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Melissa runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melissa also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Melissa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melissa is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy store inventory and pig feed.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A., from the village of Culing Centro, Cabatuan, Isabela, is 57 years old and single. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Fe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise, she is now requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used for the same purposes. This will be Fe's sixth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia S., from Ugac Norte, Tuguegarao City, is 43 years old and married. To make a living, Amelia owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products such as hats, eyeglasses, and other accessories in the local community. Amelia is just starting this business.

In 2007, Amelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 40,000 PHP from ASKI, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Amelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia M. A. is the resident of a small city named Borewala that is famous for its shrines in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms in an area called 303 EB and lives in it with her family.

Nazia is a vigorous lady. She is a seamstress who runs her business from her home to financially support her family. She started this work because her husband’s income was not enough to meet expenses. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients, charging them between 100-150 PKR. Her customers feel comfortable with this amount and order her clothes regularly. She is perfect in her measurements, uses good designs and gives her clothes a new look.

Nazia’s husband is a rickshaw driver named M. A.. Unfortunately, his rickshaw’s engine is presently not working properly. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband so that he can repair his rickshaw. Nazia hopes that with this loan her husband will able to make this repair properly and so continue in his work without further stress.

loans.use: To repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Jeffy

texts.en:
Jeffy R. is 26 years old, married and has an eight-month-old child. He is from the town of Santa Josefa in the province of Agusan del Sur on the island of Mindanao. Jeffy is a farmer, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in business for over five years.

Jeffy joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. Jeffy is requesting a loan, his first from CEVI, of 4000 PHP that will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. He plans to use all additional revenue generated to improve his business and support his family financially.

loans.use: To buy general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane T. is 44 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the town of Trento. Jane is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. Jane has been in business for over ten years.

Jane joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid her first loan. Jane is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to pay school tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lolahon's Group

texts.en:
Lolahon S., age 49, is the leader of this group loan. Lolahon is a widow with two sons who attend school. At the same time, the first son works in construction and the second is engaged in cattle breeding. Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 5700 KGS, Lolahon bought a bull and then resold it after fattening. She has been breeding cattle ever since. With this loan, she will purchase a bull.  In the near future she plans to start repairing the house.

Aishahon A., age 51, is the treasurer of the group. She is married with three grown sons who work in construction. Her husband is a welder.  Aishahon applied for the loan because she needs to contribute to her son’s wedding.

Ibaydila A., 63, is married with three sons.  The first son works in construction, the second is a driver, and the youngest is still in school.  Ibaydila and his wife are farmers.  When the collective farms broke up in 1996, they got some land which they now use for growing different fruits and vegetables. They will use the loan to purchase potato seeds and mineral fertilizers for farming.  In the future he wants to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for his son.

Askarbek M., 55, is married. He has a son and two daughters.  The son is a constructor, the first daughter is married, and the second is at school. Askarbek and his wife are engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase a bull for breeding. 


About Mol Bulak Finance (MBF):
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
- People, building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society
- Planet, keeping environmentally-friendly
- Profit, earning revenue to expand autonomously
MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a resident of Lahore,  the 2nd largest city in Pakistan, well-known for its history and culture. She is a 46-year-old housewife, and the mother of six daughters and a son. Her three younger daughters are currently in school and her three elder daughters work. The first two sew clothes and the third teaches in a nearby school. Her son has earned a bachelor degree and is currently looking for a job.  Her husband is a fruit seller in the market.  They all are very gentle people and live in a three-room brick house in the area of Shalimar Town.

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling. Kalsoom is hopeful that by investing money in her husband’s business, her husband will be able to increase his income and sales. She also hopes that her son will find a suitable job soon which will help her family to live a better standard of living. Kalsoom is a regular client of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She has a good credit record.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for selling.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann M. is from the town of Trento. She is 39 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann has been farming rice for over 10 years. She works hard to provide for her children's education.  Mary Ann joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Intizorhon's Group

texts.en:
Intizorhon M. is the leader of this group loan. She is 31 and married with two sons and two daughters. The sons attend school and the daughters are not yet old enough. Her husband works in a factory and earns 8000 KGS per month. Intizorhon raises poultry and seeks a loan to purchase more chickens and turkeys for breeding.  In the future she plans to build a shed and start repairing the house.

Sanabarhan B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 32 and married with two sons and two daughters.  Her husband works in construction. Sanabarhan breeds farm animals, reselling some animals after fattening, and she earns 2000 KGS per month.  The loan will enable her to purchase some farm animals for breeding and to purchase building materials to start repairing the house.

Talantbek G., age 26, is married. His wife is a teacher at university. Talantbek is building a house for his family and applied for a loan to purchase cement for building the house.

Nargizahon M., age 26, is married. Her husband works in construction and she breeds poultry, earning 900 KGS per month selling eggs and chickens.  She will use the loan to purchase more chickens for breeding.  In the future she plans to start repairing the house.

About Mol Bulak Finance (MBF):
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society)
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly)
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously)
MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan, famous for its gardens and culture. She lives in a little house with her brother and 18-year-old daughter. She is a 45-year-old widow. She couldn’t complete her education because her mother didn’t have enough resources to afford it. Parveen sells clothes to put three daily meals on the table for her family. She started this business after her husband’s death few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her but she never gave up.  Her daughter does embroidery, and her brother sells costume jewelry in his shop at the nearby market.
 
Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy more clothes for selling. Her daughter is near marrying age, and it is Parveen’s responsibility to marry her. She is hopeful that with the increased profit of her business she will collect the dowry and marry her daughter. This is her first loan and she hopes that it will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 30-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a teacher at one of the primary schools in the area. As a salary earner, his income is fixed irrespective of what he achieves at work; thus, he says he needs to have a side income. His biggest priority is education for his dependants. He is starting a prominent business for increased income generation. He is constructing a commercial house so as to earn extra income to sustain them. This is his first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to purchase iron sheets and doors for the completion of his commercial house which is now under construction.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets and doors to complete his commercial house

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda B. is from the town of Trento. She is 52 years old and married with 5 children who attend school.  She works hard to sustain their education. To make a living, Rosalinda raises livestock, primarily raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and support her family financially.

loans.use: To buy young livestock for fattening.

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is a resident of Lahore, the second-largest city in Pakistan. She lives in a three-room house with her family. She is 50 years old and married to M. F. H., a mechanic. She has 4 sons and 2 daughters. Ghulam and her husband worked very hard all through their lives to provide an education to their children. Her eldest son has earned his masters degree and is seeking work. Her second son has recently completed his bachelor degree, and her third son, age 22, works in the automotive workshop of his father. He didn’t have any interest in education and is therefore illiterate. Her three younger children still attend school.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy better tools for her husband’s auto shop. Ghulam Fatima knows that her husband has a lot of experience in his business and she is confident that he will be able to get positive results by investing money in his business.  She is a regular client of Asasah and this is her 4th loan. She has repaid her past loans on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy tools for auto repair.

loans.name: Ilyne

texts.en:
Ilyne S. is from the village of Culing Centro, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 48 years old and widowed with one child. To make a living, Ilyne plans to start a business growing vegetables to sell. Ilyne joined ASKI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ilyne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI, and now requests a 8000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 47-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married to a businesswoman and, like many African men, Stephen has ten children. He sustains a family of 15 people and he hopes to ensure they all get a bright future. He is a banker but is a major helping hand in his wife's business as well. This is Stephen’s fifth loan and, as for many parents and guardians, the issue at hand is payment of school fees; thus, he intends to use the loan proceeds to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Joshua Obongo

texts.en: Joshua Obongo, age 31, is married with three children ages 1, 3, and 9.  He has been a welder for about six years. His business is busy with a constant flow of customers. His wife also works to help support the family. Joshua learned about KADET microfinance through a friend who is also a KADET client. He now requests his second loan, for 50,000 KES, to buy supplies for his welding work. Joshua hopes to expand his business and increase his income so he can adequately support his family.

loans.use: To buy welding supplies.
